constitio: <entryFree id="n10631" type="main" key="consti^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consisto</etym>, <sense id="n10631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abiding, abode, stay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <trans><tr>in the same place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constituo: <entryFree id="n10632" type="main" key="consti^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n10632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to stand, put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay down, to set, put, place, fix, station, deposit a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> somewhere (esp. <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">immovably</hi>), etc. (the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> corresponding to consistere; class.). </sense><sense id="n10632.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10632.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem ante pedes Q. Manilii constituunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vobis (dīs) candentem taurum ante aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias praedonum contractas in urbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum aliquem lectorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut in aliquā sublimi speculā constitutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hujus vobis adulescentiam proposueritis, constituitote vobis ante oculos etiam hujus miseri senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n10632.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10632.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To station</hi> or <hi rend="ital">post troops</hi> somewhere, <hi rend="ital">to draw up, set in order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem Caesar passibus CC. ab eo tumulo constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones pro castris in acie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 35: aciem ordinesque intra silvas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octo cohortes in fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod reliquum peditum erat, obliquo constituerunt colle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 33, 8 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad latus apertum hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves aperto ac plano litore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves nisi in alto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsidiarias (naves) in secundo ordine, Auct. B. Alex. 14, 3: classem apud Salamina exadversum Athenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia in Rutenis provincialibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of a single person: se constituere, <hi rend="ital">to station</hi> or <hi rend="ital">post one's self</hi>: dum se Gallus iterum eodem pacto constituere studet, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.7" n="2" level="3"> In contrast with a march, <hi rend="ital">to cause to halt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper agmen constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 49, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 28, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 25, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa paulisper novitate rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—And trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">si constituitur aliquando (narratio) ac non istā brevitate percurritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 328</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.8" n="B" level="2"> With the access. idea of preparation, <hi rend="ital">to set up, erect, establish, found, build, construct, prepare, make, create, constitute</hi> (class. and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n10632.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus humanum, quorum omnia causā constituisse deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem apparare, vineas agere, turres duas constituere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castella ad extremas fossas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas ac testudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locis certis horrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feralis cupressos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem quercum in tumulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyras curvo in litore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor aras ad alta delubra dearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 542</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem in foro geminis fratribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <trans><tr>to found</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nova moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 194</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia in Aside terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domicilium sibi Magnesiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triplex Piraeei portus constitutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna omnium legionum in Belgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di primum homines humo excitatos celsos et erectos constituerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring about, effect, establish, appoint</hi>, etc., freq. of judicial determinations, etc.: videte,<pb n="438" /> <cb n="CONS" />  per deos immortalis, quod jus nobis, quam condicionem vobismet ipsis, quam denique civitati legem constituere velitis, <hi rend="ital">to establish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 14, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus melius Sullanis praediis quam paternis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium de pecuniis repetundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium capitis in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:10" default="NO">4, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratiocinationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac accusatione comparandā constituendāque laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; and of persons, <hi rend="ital">to designate, appoint, select, put forward</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare accusatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 67, 191</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">testis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutores pupillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuper apud C. Orchivium collegam meum locus ab judicibus Fausto Sullae de pecuniis residuis non est constitutus,</quote> <trans><tr>no trial of him was permitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reum statim fecit, utique ei locus primus constitueretur impetravit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 9, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">si utilitas amicitiam constituet, tollet eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 7:27" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 7, 27</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">25: amicitiae permultae comparantur): libertatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem (opp. bellum gerere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum mali sibi ac liberis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25, § 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.11" n="C" level="2"> With the access. idea of ordering, contriving, <hi rend="ital">to establish, fix, appoint, settle, order, manage; to confirm, regulate, arrange, dispose</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10632.12" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ti. et C. Gracchos plebem in agris publicis constituisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have established</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi futuros Helvetios, ubi eos Caesar constituisset,</quote> <trans><tr>should assign them a permanent abode</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges in civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Commium regem ibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviralem potestatem in omnibus urbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curatores legibus agrariis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">publice patronum huic causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 2, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composita et constituta res publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene morata et bene constituta civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <trans><tr>to organize</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tibi concesserit ... reliquas utilitates in constituendis civitatibus ... a disertis ornateque dicentibus esse constitutas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chersoneso tali modo constituto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res summā aequitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem nummariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem familiarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ineuntis aetatis inscitia senum constituenda et regenda prudentiā est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">majores vestri majestatis constituendae gratiā bis Aventinum occupavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam perfectis constitutisque viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 57</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: non tam sinistre constitutum est, ut non, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">we are not so badly off as not</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45, 5</bibl>.—Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenaeum in maximā apud regem auctoritate gratiāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sibi quaestoris in loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in potestate aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 55, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituuntur in honoribus, cum magistratus creantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cont. adv. Leg. 1:45 al" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cont. adv. Leg. 1, 45 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10632.14" n="D" level="2"> With the access. idea of limiting, fixing, allotting, <hi rend="ital">to fix, appoint something</hi> (<hi rend="ital">for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to something</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to settle, agree upon, define, determine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10632.15" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter dissensionem placuerat dividi thesauros finesque imperii singulis constitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 31, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium frumento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:73:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 73, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certam pecuniam proconsulibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propria loca senatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 180</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias in hunc diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem concilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem colloquio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posterum diem pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotio proximum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum tempus ei rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandiorem aetatem ad consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus in posterum diem locumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam ad constitutam non venerat diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, tempus constitutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum credendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: de numero pastorum alii angustius, alii <cb n="CONS" /> laxius constituunt: <cit><quote lang="la">ego in octogenas hirtas oves singulos pastores constitui, Atticus in centenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.16" n="b" level="4"> T. t. of the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">to accord, agree with one in a thing, to appoint, fix, to concert, agree upon, assent to</hi> (cf. Gron. Obss. p. 14 sq.); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid cum aliquo, alicui, inter se</hi>, or with <case>acc.</case> only, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10632.17" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubiea dies, quam constituerat cum legatis venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactam et constitutam esse cum Manlio diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitui cum quodam hospite, Me esse illum conventuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitui cum hominibus, quo die mihi Messanae praesto essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27, § 65</bibl></cit>: cum aliquo, ut, etc., Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>; cf. under <pos>P. a.</pos>, B. 2.—</sense><sense id="n10632.18" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Cincio HS. XXCD. constitui me curaturum Idibus Febr.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nocturnae Numa constituebat amicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sane, inquit, vellem non constituissem, in Tusculanum me hodie venturum esse, Laelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:de Or. 1:62:265" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 62, 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.19" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> only or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadimonia constituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pecuniā constitutā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13</bibl></cit>, tit. 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Vaccenses) compositis inter se rebus in diem tertiam constituunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic constituunt, sic condicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:487" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 487</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Avillius, ut erat constitutum, simulat se aegrotare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.20" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituendi sunt qui sint in amicitiā fines deligendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte quaereretur quae esset ars imperatoris, constituendum putarem principio, quis esset imperator: qui cum esset constitutus administrator quidam belli gerendi, tum adjungerem, etc. (for which, soon after, definire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl></cit>; cf. C. 1. supra, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum satis constitui molestiaene plus an voluptatis attulerit mihi Trebatius noster,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut constitueret, honestum esse aliquid quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona possessa non esse constitui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 29, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hoc Antigonus cum solus constituere non auderet, ad consilium retulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.21" n="E" level="2"> With the access. idea of resolving, <hi rend="ital">to determine to do something, to take a resolution, to resolve, decide, determine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10632.22" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis mare Neptunum Cereremque vocare Constituit fruges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes duas in Nantuatibus collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum cum Germanis gerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanorum adventum exspectare atque ibi decertare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desciscere a rege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.23" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audio constitutum esse Pompeio et ejus consilio in Siciliam me mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10632.24" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum pecuniae quaeque civitas daret, Aristides delectus est, qui constitueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10632.25" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus uti irem, jam heri constitueram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitueram, ut pridie Idus Aquini manerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituimus inter nos ut ambulationem conficeremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus cum ceteris constituerant, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10632.26" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (acc. to B.), <hi rend="ital">constituted, arranged, disposed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene constitutum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri sapientes et bene naturā constituti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotus quisque philosophorum invenitur, qui sit ita moratus, ita animo ac vitā constitutus, ut ratio postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui integri sunt et sani et bene constituti de rebus domesticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.27" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to C.) <hi rend="ital">Fixed, established</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus siderum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimina (opp. fortuita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam confirmatae constitutaeque vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.28" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10632.29" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to B.) <hi rend="ital">An institution, ordinance, law</hi> (mostly postclass.), Cod. Th. 1, 11, 5; 12, 41, 1.—</sense><sense id="n10632.30" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videas ordinem rerum et naturam per constituta procedere,</quote> <trans><tr>according to established laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10632.31" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to D. 1. b.) <hi rend="ital">An agreement, appointment, accommodation; a compact</hi> (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ante rem quaeruntur, quae talia sunt, apparatus, conloquia, locus, constitutum, convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:12:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 12, 52</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescripsit constitutum se cum eo habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutum factum esse cum servis, ut venirent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 25, 61</bibl></cit>; and humorously: si quod constitutum cum podagra<cb n="CONS" />  habes, fac ut in alium diem differas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad constitutum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se proripu it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without a verb,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 16</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 1</bibl>, the better read. is consili).</sense></entryFree>
constitutio: <entryFree id="n10633" type="main" key="consti^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>constituo</etym>. <sense id="n10633.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a constitution, disposition, nature</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">firma corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit> (as transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">eu)sta/qeia th=s sarko/s</foreign>); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 10</bibl> and 14: <cit><quote lang="la">prima naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10633.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10633.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A definition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea constitutio summi boni, quae est proposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:16:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 16, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10633.3" n="B" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">the issue in a cause, the point in dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutio est prima conflictio causarum ex depulsione intentionis profecta, hoc modo: Fecisti: Non feci, aut: Jure feci, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl> and 19; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 2 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10633.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A regulation, order, arrangement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec temporis unius nec hominis esse constitutionem rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45, 69</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 31, 53: constitutio est in lege, more, judicato, pacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:5" default="NO">5, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:99 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 21, § 99 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10633.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an imperial regulation, order</hi>: quodcumque ergo imperator per epistulam promulgavit, vel cognoscens decrevit, vel edicto praecepit, legem esse constat; <cit><quote lang="la">hae sunt quae constitutiones appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 5, § 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
constitutionarius: <entryFree id="n10634" type="main" key="consti^tu_ti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>constitutio</etym>, <sense id="n10634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who presides over the copying of the imperial constitutions</hi>, Gest. ap. Sen. Recip. Th. Cod.</sense></entryFree>
constitutor: <entryFree id="n10635" type="main" key="consti^tu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>constituo</etym>, <sense id="n10635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orderer, arranger</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum omnium Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus machinator constitutorque rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatorque cunctorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SACRI CERTAMINIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 254, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CONSTITVTORES COLLEGII NVMINIS DOMINORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2389</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
constitutorius: <entryFree id="n10636" type="main" key="consti^tu_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>constituo, D. 1. b.</etym>; in the jurists, <sense id="n10636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to agreement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 5, 20 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:59" default="NO">46, 3, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constitutum: <entryFree id="n10637" type="main" key="consti^tu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>constituo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B.</entryFree>
constitutus: <entryFree id="n10638" type="main" key="consti^tu_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from constituo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10639" type="gloss" key="consti^tu_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constĭtūtus</orth> <itype>hominum</itype>, <sense id="n10639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a meeting of persons</hi>: a consistentium multitudine appellatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
consto: <entryFree id="n10640" type="main" key="consto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stātum</itype> (constātūrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:41:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 41, 5</bibl>; Lact. Opif. Dei, 7, 11), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n10640.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To stand together, stand with</hi> some person or thing. </sense><sense id="n10640.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">constant, conserunt sermones inter se drapetae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stand with, to agree with, be in accord</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreement, to correspond, fit.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10640.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (cf. consisto, II. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">considerabit, constetne oratio aut cum re aut ipsa secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiā non constare cum superioribus et inferioribus sententiis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri similis narratio erit, si spatia temporum, personarum dignitates, consiliorum rationes, locorum opportunitates constabunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si humanitati tuae constare voles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—And esp. with sibi, <hi rend="ital">to agree, accord with itself, to remain like one's self, be consistent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Oppianico sibi constare et superioribus consentire judiciis debuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 22, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">with consentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut constare in vitae perpetuitate possimus nobismetipsis nec in ullo officio claudicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 119</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sibi (opp. titubare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi et rei judicatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 38, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 127</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constat idem omnibus sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.6" n="4" level="3"> In the phrase ratio constat, mercantile t. t., <hi rend="ital">the account agrees</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is correct, is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proves right</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri ratio constat: aurum in aerario est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ratio impensarum constaret,</quote> <trans><tr>was correct, accurately kept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.7" n="(b)" level="5"> In postAug. prose, esp. in the younger Pliny, transf. from the sphere of business: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum est, quam singulis diebus in urbe ratio aut constet aut constare videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 16</bibl>; 3, 18, 10; 2, 4, 4; 7, 6, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 38, 4</bibl>; Just. praef. § 5: eam condicionem esse imperandi, ut non aliter ratio <pb n="439" /> <cb n="CONS" /> constet, quam si uni reddatur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10640.8" n="II" level="1"> With the access. idea of firmness, <hi rend="ital">to stand firm, to remain immovable, unchanging, steadfast, to abide, last, endure, persevere</hi>, etc. (very freq. in all perr. and styles). </sense><sense id="n10640.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">prius quam totis viribus fulta constaret hostium acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pugna deinde illis constare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 30, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non color, non vultus ei constaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 34, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo ei neque corporis neque animi constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sanitas constabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mentibus solum consipere, sed ne auribus quidem atque oculis satis constare poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 42, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ebrietate lingua non constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente vix constare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 20, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā in sententia si constare voluissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus legionum constat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris exercitibus constare fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrimque fides constitit,</quote> <trans><tr>kept their word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 32, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 13, 9</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: cum sint huc forsitan illa, Haec translata illuc; <cit><quote lang="la">summā tamen omnia constant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the principal sum remains always the same</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam cuncta videt caelo constare sereno,</quote> <trans><tr>every thing continues in unbroken serenity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitit in nullā qui fuit ante color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 120</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10640.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10640.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to stop, halt</hi>: multitudinem procul hostium constare videtur, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 273, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10640.12" n="2" level="3"> Of facts, reports, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be established, settled, certain, manifest, evident, well known</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum constent, perspicuum debet esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum quae constant exempla ponemus, horum quae dubia sunt, exempla adferemus, id. mv 1, 38, 68: quod nihil nobis constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et factum constet et nomen, qualia sint vocatur in dubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:12:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 12, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum factum constat, sed a quo sit factum in controversiam venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi multa agitanti constabat, paucorum civium egregiam virtutem cuncta patravisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnibus constabat, hiemari in Gallia oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.13" n="b" level="4"> Constat (constabat, constabit, etc., <hi rend="ital">it is settled, established, undisputed, certain, well known</hi>, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 29, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 533</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 90</bibl> et saep.—So freq.: constat inter omnes, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf., all agree, all are convinced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed tum nimis inter omnis constabat neminem esse resalutatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae propositio in se quiddam continet perspicuum et quod constare inter omnis necesse est, hanc velle approbare et firmare nihil attinet,</quote> <trans><tr>in which all must agree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:36:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 36, 62</bibl></cit> dub. (B. and K. stare); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 8</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: constare inter homines sapientissimos (for which, just after: omnium consensu sic esse judicatum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter augures, Liv 10, 6, 7 et saep.: cum de Magio constet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de facto constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:5" default="NO">4, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi non satis mihi constiterat, cum aliquāne animi mei molestiā an potius, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis certum constare apud animum poterat, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid cuique sit opus constare decet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid porro quaerendum est? Factumne sit? At constat. A quo? At patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21, § 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.14" n="3" level="3"> Of a resolve. </sense><sense id="n10640.15" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: mihi (ei) constat, = certum est, <hi rend="ital">it is my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">his</hi>) <hi rend="ital">fixed determination, I am determined, I am fully resolved</hi> (rare): mihi quidem constat, nec meam contumeliam, nec meorum ferre, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque satis Bruto neque tribunis militum constabat, quid agerent,</quote> <trans><tr>were undecided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil ei constet quod agat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With the resolve as subject: <cit><quote lang="la">animo constat sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 748</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum constitit consilium,</quote> <trans><tr>when my mind was fully made up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.17" n="4" level="3"> In gen., as opp. to that which has no existence, <hi rend="ital">to exist, be, abide</hi> (esp. in Lucr.): <cit><quote lang="la">(corpora) quoniam fragili naturā praedita constant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 582</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:246" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:510" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 510</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquissimi fere sunt, quorum quidem scripta constent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 187</bibl>: qui sine manibus et <cb n="CONS" /> pedibus constare deum posse decreverunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ipsa mens constare potest vacans corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.18" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ex, in, de</hi>, or the <case>abl.</case> (in Cic. only with <hi rend="ital">ex;</hi> cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 8, 19</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to consist in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of, to be composed of, to rest upon something</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10640.19" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> (very freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis ignem e parvis constare figuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ex animo constat et corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:35:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 35, 98</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. Fin. l. l.: simplex (jus) e dulci constat olivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea virtus, quae constat ex hominibus tuendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10640.20" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam in earum cohortium virtute constare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> —* </sense><sense id="n10640.21" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus duplici de semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1229</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.22" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (freq. in Lucr. and Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">aeterno quia constant semine quaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 221</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:484" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 484</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:518" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 518</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">agri campis, vineis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constat tota oratio longioribus membris, brevioribus periodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:134" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:63" default="NO">5, 10, 63</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">causa constat aut unius rei controversiā aut plurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>. omnis disciplina memoriā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl>. omne jus aut scripto aut moribus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 3, 6</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10640.23" n="6" level="3"> Mercantile t. t., like our phrase, <hi rend="ital">to stand at</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cost;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">abl.. gen.</hi>, etc., of price (cf. Zumpt, Gr. § 444). </sense><sense id="n10640.24" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10640.25" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unae quadrigae Romae constiterint quadringentis milibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis gratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:19:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 19, § 48</bibl></cit> (al. stare): <cit><quote lang="la">HS. sex milibus tibi constant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">28: tanto nobis deliciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 385:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 385, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.26" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ambulatiuncula) prope dimidio minoris constabit isto loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanti funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.27" n="(g)" level="5"> With <pos>adv.</pos>: quod mihi constat carius, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 272, 25</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vilissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>. 6.—</sense><sense id="n10640.28" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus area super HS. millies constitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.29" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">edocet, quanto detrimento et quot virorum fortium morte necesse sit constare victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia constantia magno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperia pretio quolibet constant bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 664" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 664</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">constans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to II. 1.), <hi rend="ital">standing firm, firm, unchangeable, constant, immovable, uniform, fixed, stable, invariable</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10640.30" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis constantior est natura (sc. quam aquae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constans uva contra tenorem unum algoris aestusve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in indomito constantior inguine nervus, Quam nova arbor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus certi et constantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constans reversio stellarum (with conveniens),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantissimus motus lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil (mundo) motu constantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanti vultu graduque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: aetas, <hi rend="ital">the mature age</hi> (of an adult), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constans aetas, quae media dicitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate nondum constanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <trans><tr>firm, secure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an ire comminus et certare pro Italiā constantius foret,</quote> <trans><tr>safer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10640.31" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Agreeing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accordant with itself, consistent, harmonious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemadmodum in oratione constanti, sic in vitā omnia sint apta inter se et convenientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil intellego dici potuisse constantius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilia an inter se constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constans parum memoria hujus anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constans fama erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10640.32" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">intellectually</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morally certain, sure, steadfast, constant, faithful, steady, unchanging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmi et stabiles et constantes amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem hominem? Levem? imo gravissimum. Mobilem? imo constantissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. opp. varium, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 48</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">pater amens at is quidem fuit omnium constantissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>a very constant, steadfast man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prudens et constans (testis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; and under <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Helvidius Priscus) recti pervicax, constans adversus metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constans Fortuna tantum in levitate suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:8:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: neque fidei constans, neque strenuus in perfidiā, Tac. <cb n="CONS" /> H. 3, 57: <cit><quote lang="la">constantior In vitiis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">constanter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n10640.33" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to A.) <hi rend="ital">Firmly, immovably, steadily, constantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manere in suo statu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: constanter ac perpetuo placet consilium, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiis gaudere constanter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut maneamus in perspicuis firmius et constantius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus caeli constantissime conficiens vicissitudinis anniversarias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10640.34" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Harmoniously, evenly, uniformly, consistently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter et aequaliter ingrediens oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:198" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 58, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi constanter convenienterque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 24</bibl>; in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 25</bibl>; in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hi constanter omnes nuntiaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>with one voice, unanimously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabilius atque constantius sese res humanae haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabilius atque constantius regere provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10640.35" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to B.) <hi rend="ital">Steadily, calmly, tranquilly, sedately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter ac non trepide pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">agere, Auct. B. Afr. 84: proelium inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter et sedate ferre dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter et libere se gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter prudenterque fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter delata beneficia (with judicio, considerate, and opp. repentino quodam impetu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera exsequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrius quam constantius proelium inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitias retinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 45 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
constrator: <entryFree id="n10641" type="hapax" key="constra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-strātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sterno</etym>, <sense id="n10641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leveller, quieter, calmer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Technop. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
constratum: <entryFree id="n10642" type="main" key="constra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1, consterno, I. 2.</entryFree>
constratus: <entryFree id="n10643" type="main" key="constra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. consterno.</entryFree>
constrepo: <entryFree id="n10644" type="main" key="constre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-strĕpo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to resound, sound loudly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boisterously, to make a noise</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n10644.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus tota constrepebat hymenaeum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 154, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl>, p. 261, 34.—</sense><sense id="n10644.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a vivid speech: <cit><quote lang="la">horum omnium et testimoniis et exemplis constrepebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
constricte: <entryFree id="n10645" type="main" key="constricte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constrictē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. constringo, <sense id="n10645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
constrictio: <entryFree id="n10646" type="main" key="constricti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constrictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>constringo</etym> (postclass.), <sense id="n10646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drawing together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 84" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10646.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a binding, stopping of the bowels</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
constrictivus: <entryFree id="n10647" type="main" key="constricti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constrictīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drawing together, contracting, astringent</hi> (in later medic. writers): <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 18 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">constrictīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">astringently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:38" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
