constricto: <entryFree id="n10648" type="hapax" key="constricto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constricto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to draw together;</hi> of a physician (with inurere, amputare, etc.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constrictura: <entryFree id="n10649" type="main" key="constrictu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constrictūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:9:69" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 9, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constrictus: <entryFree id="n10650" type="main" key="constrictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from constringo.</entryFree>
constringo: <entryFree id="n10651" type="main" key="constringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stringo</orth>, <itype>strinxi, strictum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to draw together, bind together, to bind, tie up</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10651.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10651.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vineam alligato recte, dum ne nimium constringas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:80" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 80</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haec Amor ipso suo constringet pignera signo,</quote> <trans><tr>stamp, seal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20, 17</bibl></cit> (4, 20, 7).—</sense><sense id="n10651.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., freq., </sense><sense id="n10651.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bind together with fetters, to fetter, bind</hi> (a criminal, insane person, etc.). </sense><sense id="n10651.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora vinculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum laqueis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 41, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10651.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pro moecho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem quadrupedem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hands and feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 23 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu mentis es compos? Tu non constringendus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10651.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te hodie constringam ad carnarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10651.8" n="2" level="3"> T. t. of medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to draw together, contract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constringens vis suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 54, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in febribus constrictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:120 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 7, 63, § 120 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10651.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10651.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind together, to bind, fetter, restrain, hold in check</hi>, etc. (a <pb n="440" /> <cb n="CONS" /> favorite trope of Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. less freq.): illa pars animi vinciatur et constringatur amicorum custodiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem omnium horum conscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem religione potius quam veritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">psephismata jure jurando,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges immutabili necessitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem terrarum novis legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulieres), quae Oppiis quondam aliisque legibus constrictae, nunc, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus fraudemque odio civium supplicioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitione constricti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullā religione, ut scelus tegat, se posse constringi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10651.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of discourse or reasoning, <hi rend="ital">to bring into a narrow compass, to compress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sententia) cum aptis constricta verbis est, cadit etiam plerumque numerose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constricta narratio (opp. latius fusa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (ars logica) rem dissolutam divulsamque conglutinaret et ratione quādam constringeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 188</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">constrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., compressed, contracted, abridged, short, brief, concise, compact</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <trans><tr>knit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia (opp. dissidentia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <trans><tr>pruned, confined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">folium tenuius et constrictius et angustius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 10, 32, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives perpetuo rigore,</quote> <trans><tr>condensed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulticula constrictior,</quote> <trans><tr>thicker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 108</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> not in use.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-strictē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">closèly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constrictius jungi alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 1:28" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
constructio: <entryFree id="n10652" type="main" key="constructi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constructĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>construo</etym>, <sense id="n10652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">placing together, a joining together</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.; not in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10652.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Polyb. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Polyb. 18</bibl></cit> (37), 2.—</sense><sense id="n10652.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an erecting, building, construction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 86</bibl></cit>: ejus (gymnasii), Traj. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 40</bibl> (49), 2.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 22, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10652.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10652.4" n="A" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">a fit connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum constructio et numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio conformanda non solum electione, sed constructione verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo tam minuta haec constructio appareat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10652.5" n="B" level="2"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">grammatical connection, construction</hi> ( = conformatio verborum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 151</bibl>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1061 sq.</bibl> P. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
constructus: <entryFree id="n10653" type="main" key="constructus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constructus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from construo.</entryFree>
construo: <entryFree id="n10654" type="main" key="constru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-strŭo</orth>, <itype>struxi, structum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> constrŭĭtūra, Ven. Carm. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10654.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To heap, bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gather together, to heap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pile up</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">acervos nummorum apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus et modis constructā et coacervatā pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and acervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 96</bibl></cit>: carros, <hi rend="ital">to make a barricade</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">has omnes multas magnificasque res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copiam ornamentorum uno in loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">162: super prela congeriem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 318</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10654.2" n="II" level="1"> (Like compono, II.) <hi rend="ital">To make by piling up, to make, fabricate, construct, build</hi> (class.; most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10654.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">construere atque aedificare mundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut navem, ut aedificium idem destruit facillime qui construxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:145" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum saxo quadrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea saxeo muro constructa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">pilam saxeam magnis molibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia sibi nidosque (aves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nidum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentibus in ore constructis manditur cibus,</quote> <trans><tr>arranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>: large multiplici constructae sunt dape mensae, <hi rend="ital">furnished</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 304</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10654.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in gram. lang., <hi rend="ital">to connect grammatically, construct</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1099 sq.</bibl> P. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
constupeo: <entryFree id="n10655" type="hapax" key="constu^pe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stŭpĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <sense id="n10655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to be very much astonished</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
constuprator: <entryFree id="n10656" type="hapax" key="constu_^pra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">constū^prātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>constupro</etym>, <sense id="n10656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defiler, debaucher</hi>: stuprati et constupratores, Liv 39, 15, 9.</sense></entryFree>
constupro: <entryFree id="n10657" type="main" key="constu_^pro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-stū^pro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to violate, ravisn, debauch, defile</hi> (rare, but in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10657.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">matronas, virgines, ingenuos, raptos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetextatos liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12 al.</bibl> <cb n="CONS" /> —</sense><sense id="n10657.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflicta res publica est empto constupratoque judicio,</quote> <trans><tr>purchased by debauchery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër scelestis vocibus constupratus,</quote> <trans><tr>polluted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consuadeo: <entryFree id="n10658" type="main" key="consu^a_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭādĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to advise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">counsel strongly</hi> (Plautin.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">however, consuasor): id consuadeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuadet homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui consuadet, vetat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>.—Of favorable auspices: <cit><quote lang="la">picus et cornix ab laevā consuadent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consualia: <entryFree id="n10659" type="main" key="Consu^a_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consŭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Consus.</entryFree>
consuasor: <entryFree id="n10660" type="hapax" key="consu^a_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭāsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consuadeo</etym>, <sense id="n10660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who strenuously counsels to something, a counsellor, adviser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctore et consuasore Naevio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consuavio: <entryFree id="n10661" type="main" key="consu^a_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭāvĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sāv-</orth>), āre; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭāvĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sāv-</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to kiss much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">affectionately</hi> (only in App.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 182, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>, p. 120, 31.</sense></entryFree>
consubigo: <entryFree id="n10662" type="main" key="consu^bi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭbĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to work, knead</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">mix together</hi> (late Lat.): cineres, lixiva, etc., Garg. Mart. de Cura Boum <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consubstantialis: <entryFree id="n10663" type="main" key="consubstanti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-substantĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n10663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of like essence, nature</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">substance, consubstantial</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 44 al.</bibl>—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
consubstantialitas: <entryFree id="n10664" type="main" key="consubstanti^a_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consubstantĭālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consubstantialis</etym>, <sense id="n10664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a like quality</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
consubstantivus: <entryFree id="n10665" type="main" key="consubstanti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-substantīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> ( = consubstantialis), <sense id="n10665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of like essence, nature</hi>, etc. (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> and 18.</sense></entryFree>
consudasco: <entryFree id="n10666" type="hapax" key="consu_dasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consūdasco</orth> (in a few MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sūdesco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [consudo], <hi rend="ital">to sweat much;</hi> of olives packed up, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consudo: <entryFree id="n10667" type="main" key="consu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sūdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to sweat much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profusely</hi> (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 96, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consuefacio: <entryFree id="n10668" type="main" key="consu^e_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭē-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 49</bibl>, and 3, 3, 60, consue feci, consue facere, consue facio, acc. to Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 409</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>consueo</etym>, <sense id="n10668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to accustom one to a thing, to inure, habituale</hi> (rare, and mostly ante-class. for the class. assuefacio). </sense><sense id="n10668.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in tmesis: consue quoque faciunt, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:9:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea ne me celet, consuefeci filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10668.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuefacere filium, Suā sponte recte facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>; so, Gaetulos, ordines habere, signa sequi, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10668.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil praetermitto, consuefacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 60</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10668.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuefieri alicui rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consueo: <entryFree id="n10669" type="gloss" key="consu^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to be accustomed, be wont</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 224</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 885</bibl> ib. (for consuemus in Prop.; v. consuesco <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
consuesco: <entryFree id="n10670" type="main" key="consu^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭesco</orth>, <itype>suēvi, suētum, 3</itype> (in the <sense id="n10670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi> the sync. forms prevail: consuesti, consuestis, consuerunt; consueram, etc.; consuero, etc.; consuerim, etc.; consuessem, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">consuesse. Thus also consuēmus = consuevimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10670.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to accustom, inure, habituate a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi> (ante-class. and postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum bracchia consuescunt firmantque lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencum plostro aut aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem largo umori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina falcem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 14, § 70</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">perf. part. pass</hi>. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): qui consuetus in armis Aevom agere, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 261 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">gallus auroram vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 713</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:788" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 788</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consueta domi catulorum blanda propago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:997" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 997</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias habebat in Galliā bellare consuetas locis campestribus, Auct. B. Afr. 73, 2: quibus consueti erant uterque agrestibus ferramentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socors genus mancipiorum otiis, campo consuetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ut consuetus antehac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus si perperam est consuetus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">grex comparatus ex consuetis unā (capellis),</quote> <trans><tr>those accustomed to one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. in all periods, </sense><sense id="n10670.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10670.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To accustom one's self;</hi> and (esp. freq.) in <hi rend="ital">temp. perf.</hi> (to have accustomed one's self, i. e.), <hi rend="ital">to be accustomed, to be wont;</hi> constr. in gen. with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n10670.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disjungamus nos a corporibus, id est, consuescamus mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus multos uno spiritu pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit>: cum <cb n="CONS" /> minus idoneis (verbis) uti consuescerem, id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 34, 154</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 99</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alils parere suā vo luntate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mentiri solet pe jerare consuevit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rose. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim Rhenum transire, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Britanniam navigare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides accipere, non dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magno cum periculo mercatores ire consuerant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ipse procuratorem relinquere antea consuesset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 28, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuesso deos immortales ... his secundiores interdum res concedere, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam rem pro magnis hominum officiis consuesse tribui docebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui reges consueris tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier quae cum eo vivere consuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>.—Sometimes with ellips. of <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra): <cit><quote lang="la">quin eo (equo) quo consuevit libentius utatur (sc. uti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die quo consuerat intervallo hostes sequitur (sc. sequi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti in sollemnibus sacris fieri consuevit,</quote> <trans><tr>is wont</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10670.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene salutando consuescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 69</bibl></cit> (cf. adsuescunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 65</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">pabulum quod dabis, amurcā conspergito, primo paululum, dum consuescant, postea magis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo in teneris consuescere multum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 272</bibl></cit>.— Usu. with <pos>adv.</pos> of manner or time: <cit><quote lang="la">si liberius, ut consuesti, agendum putabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: ut consuevi, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consuemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut consuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo minus pro capite et fortunis alterius, quemadmodum consuerunt, causam velint dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl>.—In Gr. attraction: cum scribas et aliquid agas eorum, quorum consuesti, gaudeo, Lucceius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10670.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aciem justam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10670.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (aves) consuevere libero victu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:13:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:153" default="NO">10, 153</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne gravissimo dolori timore consuescerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10670.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To have carnal in tercourse with, to cohabit with</hi>, in an honorable, or more freq. in a dishonorable sense (freq. and class.); with <hi rend="ital">aliquā</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquo</hi>, with or without <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illi ... qui illā consuevit prior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quācum tot consuesset annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4</bibl></cit>. 1, 40: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieres quibuscum iste consuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 70</bibl>; Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 10</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a double sense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 88</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētus</orth> (in the poets trisyl.), a, um, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> of inanim. things which one is accustomed to, commonly employs, uses, possesses, etc., <hi rend="ital">used, accustomed; usual, ordinary, wonted, customary</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> G, 4, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:491" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 491</bibl></cit>: canistris, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:242 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 242 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores, pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 16, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetissima cuique Verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 638</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the usual manner, according to custom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere pabulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consuete: <entryFree id="n10671" type="main" key="consu^e_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consú^ētē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consuesco <sense id="n10671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consuetio: <entryFree id="n10672" type="main" key="consu^e_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consuesco, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n10672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">carnal intercourse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clandestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61, 4</bibl> Müll.; Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consuetudinarius: <entryFree id="n10673" type="main" key="consu^e_tu_di^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētūdĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consuetudo</etym>, <sense id="n10673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">customary, ordinary, usual</hi> (late Lat.): portitor. <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. Dei. 6, p. 219 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētū-dĭnārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the usual manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
consuetudo: <entryFree id="n10674" type="main" key="consu^e_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consuesco</etym>. <sense id="n10674.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A being accustomed, custom, habit, use, usage</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10674.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very freq. in all periods, esp. in prose): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatio ex quā consuetudo gignitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicunt ... consuetudine quasi alteram naturam effici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad parentium consuetudinem moremque deducimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 32, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:38:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 38, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Siculorum ceterorumque Graecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 45</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum dierum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est meae consuetudinis rationem reddere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: con <pb n="441" /> <cb n="CONS" /> suetudo mea fert, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudinem tenere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad nostram consuetudinem sunt levia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra morem consuetudinemque civilem aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod apud Germanos ea consuetudo esset, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidianae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem ex consuetudine vitae sermonisque nostri interpretemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:11:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 11, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis sensūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam in proverbii consuetudinem venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:11 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 11 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76, § 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendidior loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:12" default="NO">11, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">docendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis ac barbara hominum immolandorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">classium certis diebus audiendarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:21 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 21 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indocta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 161</bibl></cit>: mala, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:19" default="NO">12, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facere jam ex consuetudine in naturam vortit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae in consuetudine probantur,</quote> <trans><tr>generally</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negant umquam solam hanc alitem (aquilam) fulmine exanimatam. Ideo armigeram Jovis consuetudo judicavit,</quote> <trans><tr>the general opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>, ex consuetudine, pro consuetudine, and <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. consuetudine, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from custom, by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from habit, in a usual</hi> or <hi rend="ital">customary manner</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani celeriter ex consuetudine suā phalange factā impetus gladiorum exceperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:85:9" default="NO" valid="yes">85, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:42 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro meā consuetudine,</quote> <trans><tr>according to my custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine suā Caesar sex legiones expeditas ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine animus rursus te huc inducet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc cum se consuetudine reclinaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 25 al.</bibl>—Less freq.: praeter consuetudinem, <hi rend="ital">contrary to experience, unexpectedly</hi> (opp. praeter naturam), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures praeter consuetudinem armatos apparere,</quote> <trans><tr>contrary to custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10674.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Customary right, usage as a common law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(jus) constat ex his partibus: naturā, lege, consuetudine, judicato ... consuetudine jus est id, quod sine lege aeque ac si legitimum sit, usitatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 13, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 162</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine jus esse putatur id, quod voluntate omnium sine lege vetustas comprobavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 67</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 601</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.5" n="2" level="3"> In gram. (instead of consuetudo loquendi; cf. supra), <hi rend="ital">a usage</hi> or <hi rend="ital">idiom of language</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. in 8th" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. in 8th</bibl> and 9th books on almost every page; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:16" default="NO">1, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:2" default="NO">2, 5, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10674.6" n="3" level="3"> In Col. for <hi rend="ital">language</hi> in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudini Latinae oeconomicum Xenophontis tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: nostra (opp. Graeca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10674.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Social intercourse, companionship, familiarity, conversation</hi> (freq. and class; in an honorable sense most freq. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10674.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deiotarus) cum hominibus nostris consuetudines, amicitias, res rationesque jungebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">victūs cum multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 21</bibl></cit>; and in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">victūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticus usus et consuetudo est alicui cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine conjuncti inter nos sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudine ac familiaritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with familiaritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare se in consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 28, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insinuare in alicujus consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">immergere se in consuetudinem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistularum,</quote> <trans><tr>epistolary correspondence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrimentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>community</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10674.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">intercourse in love</hi>, in an honorable, and more freq. in a dishonorable sense, <hi rend="ital">a love affair, an amour, love intrique, illicit intercourse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 28</bibl>; <cb n="CONS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 6</bibl> and 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10 al.</bibl>— <cit><quote lang="la">So also freq.: consuetudo stupri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consuetus: <entryFree id="n10675" type="main" key="consu^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. consuesco <sense id="n10675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consul: <entryFree id="n10676" type="main" key="consul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consul</orth> (in the oldest inscrr. CONSOL, COSOL; abbrev. COS., also in <number>plur.</number> COSS., not before the time of the emperors), <itype>ŭlis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. from root sal- of salio; Sanscr. sar-, go; hence also exsul, praesul, v. Corss. Ausspr. II. p. 71</etym>, <sense id="n10676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consul</hi>, one of the two highest magistrates of the Roman state, chosen annually, after the expulsion of the kings; cf. concerning his election, administration, duties, etc., Dict. Antiq., and the authors there cited (freq. in all periods and species of composition): qui recte consulat, consul cluat, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 80</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl>: consul ordinarius, <hi rend="ital">one who entered on his office at the regular time</hi>, viz. <hi rend="ital">on the first of January;</hi> opp. consul suffectus, <hi rend="ital">one chosen in the course of the year in the place of one who had died</hi>, or, after the time of the emperors, as a mere honorary title; v. ordinarius and sufficio: consul designatus, <hi rend="ital">consul elect</hi> (so called in the interval between election, at the beginning of August, and entrance on his duties, on the 1st of January), v. designo: consul major, <hi rend="ital">one who had the largest number of votes</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">with whom the Fasces were</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">one who was oldest</hi> (acc. to Nieb., orig. he who was of noble origin); cf. Fest. s. v. majorem consulem, p. 161, 31 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">after the Lex Julia,</quote> <trans><tr>who had most children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem creare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sufficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:38:82 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 38, 82 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declarare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">renuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 1, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem consulem designare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse pro consule,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91:section=212 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91, § 212 al.</bibl></cit> In reference to the expression bis, iterum, ter, quater, etc.; tertio or tertium, etc, consul, v. the words bis, iterum, etc., and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl> and 6.—</sense><sense id="n10676.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10676.2" n="1" level="3"> In <case>abl.</case> with the names of the consuls (in the poets usu. of one consul), <hi rend="ital">for the designation of the year</hi>: Orgetorix M. Messalá M. Pisone Coss., regni cupiditate inductus, etc., <hi rend="ital">in the consulship of</hi> (i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the year of Rome</hi> 693), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl>: is dies erat a. d. V. Kal. Apr. L. Pisone A. Gabinio Coss. (i. e. <hi rend="ital">the 27th of March</hi>, 696 <hi rend="ital">of the city</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam venit Mario consule et Catulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:43:161 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 43, 161 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora fumum bibere instituta Consule Tullo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:6 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 6 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibuli consulis amphora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 28, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora centeno consule facta minor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a hundred years old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:45:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 45, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, as collective term for the magistracy, <hi rend="ital">the consuls</hi>, when the office is in view rather than the persons: quod populus in se jus dederit, eo consulem usurum; <cit><quote lang="la">non ipsos (sc. consules) libidinem ac licentiam suam pro lege habituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">legatisque ad consulem missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 52, 6</bibl></cit> Heerw. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter sine populi jussu nullius earum rerum consuli jus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10676.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A proconsul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 33, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf. id. § 7; 31, 49, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 6, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:14:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The highest magistrate</hi> in other states: <cit><quote lang="la">consul Tusculanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">BARCINONENSIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 4, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">COLONLAE ASTIGITANAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 351, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Clar. Urb. 14, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10676.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet of Jupiter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 3</bibl>; App. de Mundo, c. 25.—* </sense><sense id="n10676.8" n="D" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est animus tibi ... consul non unius anni,</quote> <trans><tr>continually fulfilling the duties of the highest magistracy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 39</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
consularis: <entryFree id="n10677" type="main" key="consu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consul</etym>, <sense id="n10677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a consul, consular</hi> (very freq.): aetas, <hi rend="ital">the age required by law for the consular office</hi>, viz. the 43d year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 48</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">annus, II.: comitia,</quote> <trans><tr>for the choice of consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 26, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:58:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 58, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:16" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 25, 16</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:68" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 68</bibl></cit>: femina, <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">of a consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 9, 1</bibl> res, <hi rend="ital">worthy of a consul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ortio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; and cf. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>named after the consul during whose administration it was made</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:79" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 79</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp.: homo consularis,</quote> <trans><tr>a man of consular rank, one who has been consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 79, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vir consularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl>.—And, </sense><sense id="n10677.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10677.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who has been consul, an ex-consul</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">one of consular rank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregios consules habemus, sed turpissimos consulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 12, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10677.3" n="B" level="2"> In the time of the empire, <hi rend="ital">a legate sent by the emperor as governor into a province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl> and 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63 al.</bibl>—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">consularis adoptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>. prooem. § 13 Spald.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a manner worthy of a consul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulariter acta vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consularitas: <entryFree id="n10678" type="main" key="consu^la_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consularis, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n10678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dignity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">office of consul</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperial governor</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 6, 19, 1; 6, 27, 10; 9, 26, 4 al.</sense></entryFree>
consulariter: <entryFree id="n10679" type="main" key="consu^la_ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consularis <sense id="n10679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consularius: <entryFree id="n10680" type="main" key="consu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = consularis (late Lat.): dignitas, Jul. Epit. c. 98, § 359.</entryFree>
consulatus: <entryFree id="n10681" type="main" key="consu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consul</etym>, <sense id="n10681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of consul, the consulate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consulship</hi> (very frq. in all periods): <cit><quote lang="la">honorum populi finis est consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus ille antiquus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pluris est universa respublica quam consulatus aut praetura, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:63:2" default="NO" valid="yes">63, 2</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quinque consulatus eodem tenore gesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 7</bibl>.—Esp. in the phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">appetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 73, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adipisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 14</bibl> et saep.; v. also abdico, fungor, defungor, etc.</sense></entryFree>
consulo: <entryFree id="n10682" type="main" key="consu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consŭlo</orth>, <itype>lŭi, ltum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n10682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [from con and root sal-; cf. consul and consilium]. </sense><sense id="n10682.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To consider, reflect, deliberate, take counsel, reflect upon, consult</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10682.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quid nunc? etiam consulis? <hi rend="ital">do you still deliberate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hesitate?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 171</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 75</bibl> Speng.: ne quid in consulendo adversi eveniat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulto opus est,</quote> <trans><tr>there is need of deliberation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tempus consulendi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis facere consulentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnium rerum vobis ad consulendum potestas esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tot uno tempore motibus animi turbati trepidarent magis quam
