consulerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium consulenti curiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10682.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere in longitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to take thought for the future</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune,</quote> <trans><tr>for the common good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the same sense: in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 335</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in publicum (opp. suscipere proprias simultates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">bello confecto de Rhodiis consultum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de communibus negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 105:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 105, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de salute suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus de rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere vivi ac prospicere debemus, ut illorum (liberorum) solitudo munita sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:58:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 58, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ne qua manus se attollere nobis A tergo possit, custodi et consule longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 322</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut urbi ... satis esset praesidii, consultum atque provisum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne deficerent, consulendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4, 31</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10682.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., consulere alicui or alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to take care for some person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing, to be mindful of, take care of, look to, have regard for, to counsel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consult for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuae rei bene consulere cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me fiat, parvi pendis, dum illi consulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui parti civium consulunt, partem neglegunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl></cit>: consulere eorum commodis et utilitati salutique<pb n="442" /> <cb n="CONS" />  servire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:9:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 9, § 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">famae, pudicitiae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitati meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptui sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae juxta ac sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 58, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori magis quam religioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magis irae quam famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mi consultum optime velit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: mi ires consultum male? <hi rend="ital">to counsel evil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">badly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 36</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">male patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 2, 2</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius consulet (sibi), si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10682.10" n="1" level="3"> Consulere aliquem (or aliquid), <hi rend="ital">to consult with one, to ask his opinion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advice, to ask counsel of, to consult, question</hi> (for the sake of advice). </sense><sense id="n10682.11" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te consuluissem, quid mihi faciendum esse censeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te, qui philosophum audis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apellem tragoedum, uter, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 33 al.</bibl></cit>—Of inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">speculum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectatas undas, quid se deceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares, an olerent aera Corinthōn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem de gemmis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:251 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 251 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum nostrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:18 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 18 al.</bibl></cit>—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo et consulam hanc rem amicos, quid faciundum censeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec te id consulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere prudentiorem coepi aetates tabularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88</bibl></cit>.—Freq., </sense><sense id="n10682.12" n="b" level="4"> Esp. as t. t. </sense><sense id="n10682.13" n="(a)" level="5"> In the lang. of religion, <hi rend="ital">to consult a deity, an oracle, omens</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinem de re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum consuluit auguriis, quae suscipienda essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos hominum fibris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiresiam conjectorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:63" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates nunc extis, nunc per aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cumaeam anum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:158" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avem primum visam augur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:180" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirantia exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 64</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">trepidantia exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacras sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:412" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etrusci haruspices male consulentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si publice consuletur ... sin privatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 10</bibl></cit>. —With dependent question: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus pontificum collegium consuli jussit, num omne id aurum in ludos consumi necessum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulti per ludibrium pontifices, an concepto necdum edito partu rite nuberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.14" n="(b)" level="5"> In judic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to ask advice of a lawyer, to consult</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam inanes domus eorum omnium, qui de jure civili consuli solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:46:section=120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli quidem te a Caesare scribis: sed ego tibi ab illo consuli mallem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jus consuleres, peritissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus hoc eorum qui consuluntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who are skilled in the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With dependent question: consulens eum, an seni jam testato suaderet ordinare suprema judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 92</bibl></cit>.—The formula usual in asking advice was, licet consulere? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 192</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10682.15" n="(g)" level="5"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">to take counsel with the competent authorities, to consult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirites, utrum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum de foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 39, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">62, 10: populum de ejus morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem in omnia (tribuni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 39, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10682.16" n="2" level="3"> Aliquid. </sense><sense id="n10682.17" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take counsel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deliberate upon something, to consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est consulere quiddam quod tecum volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem delatam consulere ordine non licuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consulere et explorare rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulis rem nulli obscuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:344 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 344 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis repulsi Galli quid agant consulunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.18" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To advise something, to give advice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun' consulis quicquam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 22</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab re consulit blandiloquentulus,</quote> <trans><tr>advises to his hurt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n10682.19" n="II" level="1"> Sometimes meton. (causa pro effectu). </sense><sense id="n10682.20" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take a resolution, resolve, conclude, determine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.21" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.;</hi> constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">de aliquo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de nullis quam de vobis infestius aut inimicius consuluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de perfugis gravius quam de fugitivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 43, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in humiliores libidinose crudeliterque consulebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crudeliter in deditos victosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>. <cb n="CONS" /> —</sense><sense id="n10682.22" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in concilio consuluistis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ego inducam tamen, ut illud, quod tuam in rem bene conducat, consulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: ne quid gravius de salute tuā consulas, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessime istuc in te atque in illum consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae reges irā inpulsi male consuluerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quod de uxore potuit honestius consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter mihi de illis ac de me ipso consulendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.23" n="B" level="2"> With the access. idea of judging, in the connection boni, optimi aliquid consulere, <hi rend="ital">to excuse, take in good part, interpret favorably; be contented, pleased</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">satisfied with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit consul a consulendo vel a judicando: nam et hoc consulere veteres vocaverunt, unde adhuc remanet illud Rogat boni consulas, id est bonum judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 8</bibl> Müll.: nemo hoc rex ausus est facere, eane fieri bonis, bono genere gnatis boni consulitis? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni consulendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 40</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tu haec quaeso consule missa boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:8:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 8, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 106</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:17:9" default="NO">17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:88:17" default="NO">88, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerebat argentum avaritia: boni consuluit interim invenisse minium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl></cit>, prooem. 2, § 4; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 16, 17, § 44: boni et optimi consulere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205, 28</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n10682.24" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10682.25" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Well considered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weighed, deliberated upon, maturely pondered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene consultum consilium surripitur saepissume, si minus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi omnia, quorum negotium est, consulta ad nos et exquisita deferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 250</bibl></cit>: neque eam usquam invenio, neque quo eam, neque quā quaeram consultum'st, <hi rend="ital">I know neither</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operā consultā,</quote> <trans><tr>with mature reflection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 17, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, consulto consilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultius est huic poenalem quoque stipulationem subjungere,</quote> <trans><tr>it is better. more advantageous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.26" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Knowing, skilful, experienced, practised</hi>, esp. in law; <hi rend="ital">skilled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">learned in the law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ille magis juris consultus quam justitiae fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris atque eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultissimus vir omnis divini atque humani juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanientis sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universae disciplinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lawyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu consultus modo rusticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep 2, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 83</bibl>.— Esp. with juris, often written as one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">jūrisconsultus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. h. v.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut natura non disciplinā consultus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 27, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultorum alterum disertissimum, disertorum alterum consultissimum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:40:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 40, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultiores sibimet videntur Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.27" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n10682.28" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 1. b.) <hi rend="ital">A consultation, inquiry of a deity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sostratus (sacerdos) ubi laeta et congruentia exta magnisque consultis annuere deam videt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10682.29" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">A decree, decision, resolution, plan;</hi> so first, Senatus consultum, or in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Senatusconsul-tum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a decree of the Senate</hi> (most freq. in all periods; the senatus consulta were not, like the plebiscita, the supreme law of the republic; but under the emperors, all new laws took this form, v. esp. Sandars, Introd., Just. Inst. § 15; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 2, 5),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:66:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 66, § 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum est quod senatus jubet atque constituit, nam cum auctus esset populus Romanus ... aequum visum est senatum vice populi consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, consulta Patrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 41</bibl></cit>. —Of a decree of the Sicilian council: <cit><quote lang="la">ne senatus consultum Siculi homines facere possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 146</bibl></cit>.—Also in other connections: <cit><quote lang="la">facta et consulta fortium et sapientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:24:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 24, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">facta consultaque Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 7</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta et decreta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta sese omnia cum illo integra habere,</quote> <trans><tr>all objects of consultation, plans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 108:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 108, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab occultis cavendum hominibus consultisque,</quote> <trans><tr>plans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">approbare collegam consulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CONS" /> 39, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">dum consulta petis,</quote> <trans><tr>responses, oracles, divinations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua magna,</quote> <trans><tr>decisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 410</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mollia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex consulto factum,</quote> <trans><tr>purposely, voluntarily</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30, 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">adv., considerately, deliberately, designedly, on purpose</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10682.30" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultō</orth> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">utrum perturbatione aliquā animi an consulto et cogitata fiat injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:64:5" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 14 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n10682.31" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultē</orth> (mostly ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui consulte, docte atque astute cavet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caute atque consulte gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Had. 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consultatio: <entryFree id="n10683" type="main" key="consulta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. consulto</etym>. <sense id="n10683.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mature deliberation, consideration, consultation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10683.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n10683.2" n="1" level="3"> Abstr., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:25:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 25, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aliquot dies tenuit ea consultatio, ne non reddita bona belli causā ... essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10683.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a subject of consultation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiose de consultationibus suis disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 17, 66</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10683.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., rhet. t. t. </sense><sense id="n10683.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A case proposed for decision, an inquiry concerning a case in law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultationem proponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum apud C. Caesarem consultatio de poenā Theodoti proponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10683.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A general inquiry upon a subject, a consideration of a principle</hi>, = quaestio infinita (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">definita controversia certis temporibus ac reis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive in infinitis consultationibus disceptatur, sive in iis causis quae in civitate et forensi disceptatione versantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 29, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 7, 33</bibl>; id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:9:4:1" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 9, 4, 1</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n10683.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An asking of advice, inquiry</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n10683.8" n="A" level="2"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas litteras exspecto, ut sciam, quid respondeant consultationi meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honesta consultatio, non expedita sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redeunt illi sermones, illae consultationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—So of <hi rend="ital">the questioning of the emperor by the prætor, an asking for instructions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">visa est enim mihi res digna consultatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 96</bibl></cit> (97), 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10683.9" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">the inquiry addressed to an oracle</hi> (transl. of <foreign lang="greek">peu=sis</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 50</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de consultationibus in Aponi fontem talos aureos jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consultator: <entryFree id="n10684" type="main" key="consulta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who asks advice, consults</hi> (post-Aug. and rare, for the class. consultor, III.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consultatorius: <entryFree id="n10685" type="hapax" key="consulta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consultator</etym>, <sense id="n10685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to consultation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae (hostiarum genus, in quo voluntas dei per exta disquiritur), opp. animales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consulte: <entryFree id="n10686" type="main" key="consulte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consulo, <sense id="n10686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consulto: <entryFree id="n10687" type="main" key="consulto_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. consulo, <sense id="n10687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10688" type="main" key="consulto2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consulto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>consulo</etym>. <sense id="n10688.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To reflect, consider maturely, to consult, take counsel, deliberate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10688.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.). </sense><sense id="n10688.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illaec illic in consilio duae secreto consultant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec consultanda procurandaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam rem consultandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 55, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 25, 8 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in senatu res major quaepiam consultata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:23:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anquirunt aut consultant, conducat id necne de quo deliberant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">utrum, an</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in illis statuamus consultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviri consultant quid opus facto sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 31, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 19, 4</bibl>; 36, 8, 6 al.—</sense><sense id="n10688.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">super, in</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberare et consultare de officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">de summā rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de exitu fortunarum suarum consultabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus dubiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 14, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 35, 6: consultandum super re magnā et atroci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter ipsam rem, de quā sententiae rogantur, consultabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <pb n="443" /> <cb n="CONS" /> male corde consultare, <hi rend="ital">to meditate evil in the heart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium consultas diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex re consultas tuā,</quote> <trans><tr>for your own good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 57, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 3, 1</bibl>; 24, 22, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:37" default="NO">3, 8, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:15 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10688.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of language used in counsel: <cit><quote lang="la">pars deliberativa de tempore futuro consultat, quaerit etiam de praeterito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: consultare alicui, <hi rend="ital">to take care of one, have a care for</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">delecti (sc. Patres) reipublicae consultabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 15" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10688.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take a resolution, resolve: Phron.</hi> Abi, abi. <hi rend="ital">Strab.</hi> Consultavi istuc mihi,. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 50</bibl> Weise (<hi rend="ital">loc. corrupt.;</hi> alii aliter).—</sense><sense id="n10688.9" n="II" level="1"> Consultare aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to consult one, to go to for counsel, to ask counsel of</hi>, etc. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid me consultas, quid agas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">senes ab domo ad consultandum arcessunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me (amantes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:78" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrologos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl></cit>. In this sense also in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 18</bibl>, acc. to Isa. 40, 14 (in Heb. the <hi rend="ital">Niph.</hi> <foreign />).—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10688.10" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a resolution, decision</hi>, = consultum (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.) senatus consultata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 455</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10688.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">consultantes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">they who seek advice;</hi> of a lawyer, etc., <hi rend="ital">clients</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 54</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an oracle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consultor: <entryFree id="n10689" type="main" key="consultor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consulo</etym>. * <sense id="n10689.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who maturely considers, reflects, takes counsel upon a thing</hi>, etc., Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 5, 6, 8</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 332 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n10689.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who gives counsel, a counsellor, adviser</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10689.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (several times in Sallust; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): egomet in agmine, aut in proelio consultor idem et socius periculi vobiscum adero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 47</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 103:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 103, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 61, 15</bibl> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n10689.3" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: malum consilium consultori est pessumum, Annal. Max. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 5</bibl> (acc. to Hes. Op. et D. 264: <foreign lang="greek">*(h de\ kakh\ boulh\ tw=| bouleu/santi kaki/sth</foreign>), and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prava incepta consultoribus noxae esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">sua exempla in consultores recidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10689.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita cupidine atque irā, pessumis consultoribus, grassari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10689.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who asks counsel of one, a consulter;</hi> esp. used of him who consults a lawyer in reference to a suit at law, <hi rend="ital">a client</hi> (several times in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 19, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 112</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 187</bibl></cit> (i. e. qui consulis deum, Schol.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10690" type="main" key="consultor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, v. 2. consulto <sense id="n10690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
consultrix: <entryFree id="n10691" type="hapax" key="consultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. consultor</etym>, <sense id="n10691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who has a care for, provides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consultrix et provida utilitatum opportunitatumque omnium natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consultum: <entryFree id="n10692" type="main" key="consultum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>consulo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 2.</entryFree>
consultus: <entryFree id="n10693" type="main" key="consultus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>consulo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10694" type="main" key="consultus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consultus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for consultum, only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 4, 9</bibl>: senatusconsultus a consulendo est dictus.</entryFree>
consum: <entryFree id="n10695" type="main" key="consum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sum</orth>, <itype>fŭi, fŭtūrum or fŏre</itype> (found only in the foll. exs.). <sense id="n10695.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be together with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the same time, to coexist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neque alia quaelibet passio lumbricis confuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:122" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10695.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be, to happen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confido confuturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero confore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 140</bibl></cit>; cf.: ab eo quod est confit, id est perficitur, futurum tempus infinitivi modi confore facit, id est perfectum iri, Don. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
consummabilis: <entryFree id="n10696" type="main" key="consumma_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consummo</etym>, <sense id="n10696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be perfected, susceptible of completion</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio in nobis (opp. consummata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 846</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consummatio: <entryFree id="n10697" type="main" key="consumma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (postAug.). <sense id="n10697.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A casting up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reckoning together, a summing up, a summary view</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10697.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">operarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitus Europae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 23, 37, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulorum mancipiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10697.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10697.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A union, accumulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita non haec (poma) sed consummatio omnium nocet,</quote> <trans><tr>not fruit of itself, but the use of it in addition to all other food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10697.4" n="2" level="3"> In rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a comprehending, connecting together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum plura argumenta ad unum effectum deducuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:103" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10697.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <cb n="CONS" /> <hi rend="ital">finishing, completing, accomplishing, consummation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">susceptae professionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet res minime consummationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">7: maximarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:55" default="NO">6, 1, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 30, 11</bibl> (for the Heb. <foreign />) et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a digestion of food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 28, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the main proof of their skill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 22</bibl></cit>: PRIMI PILI, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the completed time of service as</hi> primipilus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3453</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consummator: <entryFree id="n10698" type="main" key="consumma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>consummo</etym>, <sense id="n10698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a completer, finisher</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">novi testamenti (opp. initiator veteris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 22 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
consummatus: <entryFree id="n10699" type="main" key="consumma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from consummo.</entryFree>
consummo: <entryFree id="n10700" type="main" key="consummo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-summo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>summa</etym> (not in use before the Aug. per.; most freq. in Quint.). <sense id="n10700.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sum up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10700.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus aedificiorum per arithmeticen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium in assem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:10" default="NO">5, 2, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of number, <hi rend="ital">to make up, amount to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is numerus consummat ... milia tria et ducenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:10" default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bring together, unite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consummatam ejus (sc. Scipionis) belli gloriam, spectare,</quote> <trans><tr>the gathered glory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17, 3</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10700.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring about, accomplish, complete, finish, perfect, consummate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10700.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10700.6" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae consummatur partibus una dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an intercalary day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:166" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 3</bibl> supra: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia (ars),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultatem orandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1039" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1039</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parricidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil felicitate consummari (potest), quod non Augustus repraesentaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 89, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10700.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to complete a time of service</hi> (sc. stipendia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make perfect, to complete, perfect, bring to the highest perfection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10700.9" n="A" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">nec denique ars ulla consummatur ibi, unde oriendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam ante mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 32:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 32, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 31</bibl> (v. the passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">ruris exercendi scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">Severum consummari mors immatura non passa est,</quote> <trans><tr>to attain to the highest grade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:28" default="NO">10, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum est consummatus,</quote> <trans><tr>when his education is complete</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unā re consummatur animus, scientiā bonorum ac malorum inmutabili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:28" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 28</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">consummātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., brought to the highest degree, perfect, complete, consummate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10700.11" n="A" level="2"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">20: scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10700.12" n="B" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ne se perfectos protinus atque consummatos putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:119" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:14" default="NO">10, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:1 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:122" default="NO">10, 1, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">professores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 7, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
consumo: <entryFree id="n10701" type="main" key="consu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sūmo</orth>, <itype>sumpsi, sumptum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. consumpsti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 37</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> consumpse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 234</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to take wholly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n10701.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10701.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vasti surgunt immensis torquibus orbes, tergaque consumunt pelagus,</quote> <trans><tr>take up, completely cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela omnia solus pectore consumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:640" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 640</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeo tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugulo ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:813" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 813</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 745</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 2, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:54" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of food, <hi rend="ital">to eat, consume, devour</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">agri multa efferunt quae vel statim consumantur vel mandentur condita vetustati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 77: fruges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiatum (aprum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draconem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensas accisis dapibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:125 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 125 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10701.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10701.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to consume, devour, waste, squander, annihilate, destroy, bring to naught, kill</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10701.6" n="a" level="4"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">faciat quod lubet: Sumat, consumat, perdat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium per luxuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona paterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:16" default="NO">3, 11, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem materiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:876" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 876</bibl></cit>: omne <cb n="CONS" /> id aurum in ludos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> infra: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes fortunas sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes opes et spes privatas meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 2:96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 2, 96, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum incendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumpturis viscera mea flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">3: viscera fero morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum rubigine,</quote> <trans><tr>to eat, consume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of time, <hi rend="ital">to spend, pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horas multas saepe suavissimo sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendo tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:39:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 39, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem altercatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumitur vigiliis reliqua pars noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 33, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 14, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies decem in his rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo studio aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota nox in exinaniendā nave consumitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos dies per dubitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne tempus circa Medeam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuum biduum epulando potandoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>: precando Tempora cum blandis verbis, <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lose time and words in supplications</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 575</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis diebus et laboribus consumptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi longa meae consumpsti tempora noctis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 37</bibl></cit>.—Of strength, feeling, voice, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo tanta commoveri actio non posset, si esset consumpta superiore motu et exhausta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:120" default="NO">4, 2, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem instans metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam rei nimiā captatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires ipsā subtilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:23" default="NO">3, 11, 23</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 11</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: cum mare, cum terras consumpserit, aëra tentet, i. e.-<hi rend="ital">seek a refuge therein in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.7" n="b" level="4"> Of living beings. </sense><sense id="n10701.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To destroy, kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si me vis aliqua morbi aut natura ipsa consumpsisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos fortuna belli consumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum exercitum fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:41" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B.
