G. 8, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senio et maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—Facete: <cit><quote lang="la">garrulus hunc consumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Rarely, <hi rend="ital">to waste, weaken, enervate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inediā et purgationibus et vi ipsius morbi consumptus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 663</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and consumpta membra senectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10701.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To divide, make an exhaustive division of</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">inventio in sex partis consumitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid in aliquā re</hi>, rar. <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (in Cic. only with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 53</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to bestow upon something, to use, employ, spend upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">about something</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10701.13" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in agrorum emptionibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay out, invest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in monumento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studium in virorum fortium factis memoriae prodendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in armis plurimum studii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum laboris in rebus falsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam in re unā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium in musicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10701.14" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">In aliquid</hi> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nali/skein ei)/s ti</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">tota in dulces consument ubera natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 178</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 55: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem in arbusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona paterna in opera publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10701.15" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid consili Habet, ut consumat nunc, quom nil obsint doli,</quote> <trans><tr>use up, exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consumptibilis: <entryFree id="n10702" type="main" key="consumpti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consumo</etym>, <sense id="n10702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be consumed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destroyed, transient</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">vigor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consumptio: <entryFree id="n10703" type="main" key="consumpti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n10703.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A consuming, wasting, consumption</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10703.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An employing, bestowing, application, use</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 32</bibl></cit> (al. sumptione).</sense></entryFree>
consumptor: <entryFree id="n10704" type="main" key="consumptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consumer, destroyer</hi> (very rare): omnium ignis (connected with confector), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl>.—Of fire, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, § 132</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the wasters of their property, spendthrifts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Exc. Controv. 3:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Exc. Controv. 3, 1, § 3</bibl>. <pb n="444" /> <cb n="CONS" /></sense></entryFree>
consumptrix: <entryFree id="n10705" type="main" key="consumptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consumptor</etym>, <sense id="n10705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who wastes, consumes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra omnium corporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 395</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consumptus: <entryFree id="n10706" type="main" key="consumptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consumptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from consumo.</entryFree>
consuo: <entryFree id="n10707" type="main" key="consu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭo</orth>, <itype>sŭi, sūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10707.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sew, stitch</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">join together</hi> (very rare; mostly ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n10707.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 79</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:2" default="NO">7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO">8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10707.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: consuere dolos, <hi rend="ital">to devise, plan, plot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consutis dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 211</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to forbid to speak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 4</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n10707.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen.: consuere aliquid aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to stuff, stop up, fill with something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinacothecas veteribus tabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>. —Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a garment stitched together</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, § 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consupplicatrix: <entryFree id="n10708" type="main" key="consuppli^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-supplĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supplico</etym>, <sense id="n10708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who supplicates with</hi> (rare), Claud. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 66</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1501</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
consurgo: <entryFree id="n10709" type="main" key="consurgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-surgo</orth>, <itype>surrexi, surrectum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to raise one's self, to rise</hi> (esp. of a multitude), <hi rend="ital">to rise up together, stand up, arise</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10709.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10709.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Athenis ludis quidam in theatrum grandis natu venisset ... consurrexisse omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:18:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 18, 63</bibl></cit>; so, out of respect, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque in curiam venimus: honorifice consurgitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:62:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 62, § 138</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in venerationem tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(in concilio Germanorum) consurgunt ii, qui et causam et hominem probant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurrexit senatus cum clamore ad unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum ... consurrexisse et petisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 57, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi triarii consurrexerunt integri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 570</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgere tonsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgitur ex consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in plausus consurrectum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter est consurgendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:156 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 156 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toro consurgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad iterandum ictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad finitimorum motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad novas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10709.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">consurgeret aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1111</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 498</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:929" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 929</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:474" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 474</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de terra ignis corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:886" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 886</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auras corpora sponte suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1020" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1020</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare imo fundo ad aethera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terno ordine remi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen earum in tantam altitudinem consurgit quantam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa leniter et sensim clivo fallente consurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgunt geminae quercus,</quote> <trans><tr>grow up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugata vineta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gelidas consurgens Caucasus Arctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:155" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantamque operis consurgere molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 1:499" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 499</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10709.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10709.5" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings; constr., <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, also <hi rend="ital">absol., to rise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stand up for any</hi> (esp. a hostile) <hi rend="ital">action</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 19, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad novas res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iras truces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:673" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aemulationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consurgunt iterum partes,</quote> <trans><tr>rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:692" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 692</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostri curam consurge tuendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmine Maeonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10709.6" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">to arise, take rise</hi> (like A., perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vespere ab atro consurgunt venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of winds: e terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitoque novum consurgere bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 637</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā concitatione consurgat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama consurgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:75" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consurrectio: <entryFree id="n10710" type="main" key="consurrecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consurrectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>consurgo</etym>, <sense id="n10710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing up</hi> (as a sign of assent in public transactions) (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the foll. exs.): judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consus: <entryFree id="n10711" type="main" key="Consus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Consus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. from condo</etym>, <sense id="n10711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient deity of Italy, a god of the earth and of agriculture, giver of fertility, presiding over counsels and secret plans</hi>: CONSVS. CONSILIO. MARS. DVELLO. LARES. COMITIO. POTENTES., old. inscr. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 636</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 1, 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 54</bibl>.—Hence Romulus consecrated to him the games instituted with the purpose of attracting the Sabine women, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>, where this deity is called Neptunus Equester; cf. also Serv. l. l. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyl. 12</bibl> de deis. This festival,<cb n="CONT" />  subsequently celebrated annually by the Romans, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Consŭālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, fell on the 21st of August, and at this time the altar of the god, at the lower end of the Circus Maximus, was uncovered, though heaped with earth all the rest of the year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:199 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 199 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 20</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=41:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 41, 15</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 5</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq. s. v. Consualia.</sense></entryFree>
consusurro: <entryFree id="n10712" type="hapax" key="consu^surro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-sŭsurro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to whisper together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consutilis: <entryFree id="n10713" type="hapax" key="consu_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>consuo</etym>, <sense id="n10713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sewed together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crate praecinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
consutum: <entryFree id="n10714" type="main" key="consu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. consuo.</entryFree>
consutus: <entryFree id="n10715" type="main" key="consu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">consūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from consuo.</entryFree>
contabefacio: <entryFree id="n10716" type="hapax" key="conta_be^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tābĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>cĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to waste away, to wear out, consume</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (curā),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contabesco: <entryFree id="n10717" type="main" key="conta_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tābesco</orth>, <itype>tābŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to waste away gradually, to be consumed, pine away</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10717.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: cor guttatim contabescit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 92</bibl>: Artemisia luctu confecta contabuit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 75</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10717.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">o perfidiosae Fregellae, quam facile scelere vestro contabuistis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contabulatio: <entryFree id="n10718" type="main" key="conta^bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contăbŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contabulo</etym>, <sense id="n10718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining of boards together, a flooring, planking; a floor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">story, a covering of boards</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl> (four times); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proscenii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10718.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of garments, <hi rend="ital">folds, tucks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contabulo: <entryFree id="n10719" type="main" key="conta^bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tăbŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to furnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cover with boards</hi> (several times in the histt.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres contabulatas machimentaque alia quatiendis muris portabant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>built in stories</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 16, 18, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum murum ex omni parte turribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum quernis axibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare molibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to furnish with a bridge, to bridge over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. Hellespontum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contabundus: <entryFree id="n10720" type="main" key="conta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. cunctabundus.</entryFree>
contactus: <entryFree id="n10721" type="main" key="contactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. contingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10722" type="main" key="contactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. contingo</etym> (except once in Sall., perh. not ante-Aug.), <sense id="n10722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching, touch, contact</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10722.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:50" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 16, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:122" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 7, 40, § 122</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">viriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 239</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10722.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a touching of something unclean, a contagion, infection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10722.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 26, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10722.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (several times in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">neu patiamini licentiam scelerum, quasi tabem, ad integros contactu procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 48, 9</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:21:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos a contactu dominationis inviolatos habebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contactu valentiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedite a contactu ac dividite turbidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contactu bellum meditari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contages: <entryFree id="n10723" type="main" key="conta_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contact, touch</hi> (Lucretian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 734</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:337" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 337</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 280</bibl> and 1242.</sense></entryFree>
contagio: <entryFree id="n10724" type="main" key="conta_gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (contagium only in poets—and in <number>plur.</number>—and in postAug. prose writers; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 199, 2</bibl>; Marc. Vict. 1, p. 2469 P.; cf. also colluvio: contamen only in late Lat.) [id.], <sense id="n10724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching, contact, touch</hi>, in a good or bad sense. </sense><sense id="n10724.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10724.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Contagio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 132 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima calescit ... contagione pulmonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 43, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni mentione et contagione Romanorum abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10724.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Contagium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 346</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:740" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 740</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20, 18, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:47" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.4" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a union, connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contagio naturae valet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.5" n="II" level="1"> Freq., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a contacl with something physically</hi> or <hi rend="ital">morally unclean, a contagion, infection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10724.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10724.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Contagio: nolite ad me adire, ne contagio mea bonis obsit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 405 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut contagione quādam pestiferā insanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum praecipue oves contagione vexentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lichenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CONT" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">3: vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:134 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 134 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10724.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Contagium: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 472</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1235" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 1</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicini pecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agunt contagia late,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 551</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:61 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 61 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10724.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an infection, pollution, vicious companionship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">intercourse, participation, contamination</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10724.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Contagio: <cit><quote lang="la">contagione mei patris metuo malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 31</bibl></cit>; so with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus facti dictive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitandi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 193</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contagiones malorum, quae a Lacedaemoniis profectae manaverunt latius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 80</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: haec (vitia) primo paulatim crescere; post, ubi contagio quasi pestilentia invasit, civitas immutata, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 18, 2 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:9:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Contagium: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:8:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucri (connected with scabies),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deditionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 195</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10724.12" n="(g)" level="5"> Contamen, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 10</bibl> Kopp.</sense></entryFree>
contagiosus: <entryFree id="n10725" type="main" key="conta_gi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contagio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contagious</hi> (perh. only in Veg.): <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 70, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contagium: <entryFree id="n10726" type="main" key="conta_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. contagio.</entryFree>
contamen: <entryFree id="n10727" type="main" key="conta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmen</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. contagio.</entryFree>
contaminabilis: <entryFree id="n10728" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contamen</etym>, <sense id="n10728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be polluted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">defiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propheta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 20</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 9, 16.</sense></entryFree>
contaminatio: <entryFree id="n10729" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contamino</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n10729.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A polluting, contamination, defilement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expositionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 168</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10729.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Corruption, disease</hi>: ventris, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Obseq.</author> Prodig. 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contaminator: <entryFree id="n10730" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a defiler, polluter</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterni tori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contaminatus: <entryFree id="n10731" type="main" key="conta_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. contamino.</entryFree>
contamino: <entryFree id="n10732" type="main" key="conta_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tāmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>from stem tag, tango</etym>. <sense id="n10732.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">to bring into contact, touch</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10732.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">manus quibus contaminatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: contaminare, contingere, Gloss. ap. Mai, Auct. Class. VI. p. 518 a.—</sense><sense id="n10732.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bring into union, to mingle, blend together, unite</hi>. So twice in Ter. of the blending of parts of different comedies into one whole: <cit><quote lang="la">multas Graecas fabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. prol. 16</bibl>; cf. upon this Grauert, Analekten. p. 116 sq.—</sense><sense id="n10732.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To deteriorate by mingling, corrupt, contaminate, defile, stain, pollute</hi> (something by something; very freq., esp. in the trop. signif., and in Cic.; not in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10732.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">deam Syriam urinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus (connected with spurcare aquas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—Of unnatural vice: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenuos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 108, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10732.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium aegritudine aliquā,</quote> <trans><tr>to mar, efface</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se humanis vitiis (joined with se inquinare domesticis vitiis atque flagitiis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem suum lege (Canuleia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes, i. e. by adoption into a plebeian family,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines neglegentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem aliquo mendacio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 16, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem omni scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">se sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsos ac domos suas nefanda praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18, 8 al.</bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contaminati facinore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tot parricidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis flagitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus probris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia vitio paucorum (joined with corrupta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum assiduo usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., stained with guilt, polluted, contaminated, impure, vile, defiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ut consceleratos contaminatosque ab ludis abactos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 37, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars civitatis, velut contaminata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 68, 194 al.</bibl></cit>—So several times of incontinence, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene omnibus membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: homo sceleribus<pb n="445" /> <cb n="CONT" />  flagitiisque contaminatissimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9, 23</bibl>.—<pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10732.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭnāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">abandoned youths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10732.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contāmĭ-nāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">adulterated things</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut anteponantur ... integra contaminatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:18:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 18, 69</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
contanter: <entryFree id="n10733" type="main" key="contanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>cunctor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1. <sense id="n10733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contarii: <entryFree id="n10734" type="gloss" key="conta_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contus</etym>, <sense id="n10734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soldiers armed with pikes, pike-bearers</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kontofo/roi</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 40, 2</bibl> and 3.</sense></entryFree>
contatio: <entryFree id="n10735" type="main" key="conta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. cunctatio.</entryFree>
contatus: <entryFree id="n10736" type="main" key="conta_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>cunctor</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10737" type="main" key="conta_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contus</etym>, <sense id="n10737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier armed with a pike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pole</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kontofo/ros</foreign>, a kind of troops = contarii, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
contechnor: <entryFree id="n10738" type="hapax" key="contechnor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-technor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>techna</etym>, <sense id="n10738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to devise plots, contrive tricks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide modo ne illic sit contechnatus quipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contectus: <entryFree id="n10739" type="main" key="contectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. contego.</entryFree>
contego: <entryFree id="n10740" type="main" key="conte^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cover, to cover up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10740.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10740.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coria centonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locum linteis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: capita scutis, Auct. B. Afr. 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput glauco amictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:885" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 885</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se corbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spoliis contectum juvenis corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pelle contectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ejus (tumulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thus of burying: eos uno tumulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Galbae humili sepulturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in privatis ejus hortis, omnia nebulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquo ramorum contexu contegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 49</bibl> supra.—</sense><sense id="n10740.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam servili habitu, alii fide clientium contecti,</quote> <trans><tr>covered, protected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10740.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10740.5" n="A" level="2"> With the access. idea of preservation (cf. condo), <hi rend="ital">to preserve, keep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum arma omnia reposita contectaque essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10740.6" n="B" level="2"> With the access. idea of concealment, <hi rend="ital">to conceal by covering, to cover, hide, conceal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10740.7" n="1" level="3"> Of corporeal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">eas partes corporis contexit atque abdidit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10740.8" n="2" level="3"> Of abstr. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">factam injuriam illi miserae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines fronte et supercilio, non pudore et temperantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperire et recludere contecta victricium partium vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contegendis quae prima aetas et summa fortuna expeterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 13</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 7, 4, 21.</sense></entryFree>
contemero: <entryFree id="n10741" type="main" key="conte^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to stain, pollute, defile</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">torum dominae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 10:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemnenter: <entryFree id="n10742" type="main" key="contemnenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemnenter</orth>, <sense id="n10742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., in a contemptuous manner</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 515, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemnificus: <entryFree id="n10743" type="hapax" key="contemni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemnĭ-fĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemno-facio</etym>, <sense id="n10743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">despising, contemptuous, scornful</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 88, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemno: <entryFree id="n10744" type="main" key="contemno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-temno</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">contempno</orth>; cf. Ritschl Prol. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> p. 103</bibl>), tempsi (-temsi), temptum (-temtum), 3, <sense id="n10744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to consider a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing as unimportant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of small value, to value little, esteem lightly, contemn, despise, disdain, defy, not to fear</hi>, etc. (very freq. in connection with irridere, despicere, non curare, pro nihilo ducere, etc.; opp.: expetere, efferre, timere, metuere, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> and cf. aspernor; fre[qacute]. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10744.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10744.2" n="A" level="2"> With things as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quodque ea, quae plerique vehementer expetunt, contemnant et pro nihilo ducant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis voluptatem contemni et reici oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum exercitum prae Gallicanis legionibus ... magno opere contemno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romam prae suā Capuā irridebunt atque contemnent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non usque eo L. Catilina rem publicam despexit atque contempsit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (virtutem) ... reliquā ex collatione facile est conterere atque contemnere,</quote> <trans><tr>in consequence of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocrates videtur testimonio Platonis aliorum judicia debere contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna sunt ea, quae dico: noli haec contemnere (= levia habere),</quote> <trans><tr>esteem lightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: nullam rem in me esse quam ille contemnat (= non timeat), nullam in se quam <cb n="CONT" /> pertimescat, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. metuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim refutanda tantum, quae e contrario dicuntur, sed contemnenda, elevanda, ridenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 10</bibl></cit> Spald.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:38 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 38 al.</bibl> (cf. under II.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperium meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmura ponti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1045" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1045</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare res humanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva ista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem bene dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, prooem. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">metum jurisjurandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus Apollineos prae se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antoni gladios potuit contemnere (Cicero),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatem in hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:28" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 28</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullas illa suis contemnet fletibus aras,</quote> <trans><tr>neglect, leave unvisited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 4, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10744.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non contemnas lippus inungi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">coronari Olympia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 197" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 197</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10744.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut irascatur judex ... faveat, contemnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 38, 131</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.5" n="(d)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (amplitudo animi) maxime eminet contemnendis et despiciendis doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">documenta in contemnendis animalibus,</quote> <trans><tr>despicable, contemptible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 29, 43, § 104</bibl></cit>. —Esp. freq. with a negative: <cit><quote lang="la">(orationes) non contemnendae saneque tolerabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:273" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 273</bibl></cit>; cf. under II.—</sense><sense id="n10744.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of things as subjects, <hi rend="ital">to defy, be safe from, not to fear, to make light of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adamantina saxa ictus contemnere sueta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 448</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 380</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1216" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere ventos, of the island of Delos, because protected from the winds by the surrounding islands,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 77</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 360</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnunt mediam temeraria lina Charybdim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:102" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.7" n="B" level="2"> With personal objects: a te contemni ac despici ac pro nihilo haberi senatum volunt, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 436, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemni se putant (senes), despici, illudi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 18, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 10, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes istos deridete atque contemnite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 24</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit> et saep. —Se contemnere, <hi rend="ital">to put a small value upon one's self, to have an humble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">low opinion of one's self.</hi> (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi satisplacere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 21</bibl>; and inversely: se non contemnere, <hi rend="ital">to have a high regard for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">estimate of one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (Batavi) tributis contemnuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>are humiliated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res illis contemnentibus perniciei fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.9" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne T. quidem Postumius contemnendus in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:269" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 77, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 69, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae neque numero neque genere hominum contemnendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>considerable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10744.10" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to slight, speak contemptuously of, disparage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempsisti L. Murenae genus, extulisti tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 59</bibl>: populi contemnere voces, Sic. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 65</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temtus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., despised, despicable, contemptible, vile, abject</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">comtemptus et abjectus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contempta ac sordida vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vili contemptoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebellius per avaritiam ac sordes contemptus exercitui invisusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vox potest esso contemptior, quam Milonis Crotoniatae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ter. 2</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptissimorum consulum levitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16, 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temtē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">contemptibly, despicably;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> contemptius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl> (but not <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl>; v. contemptim).</sense></entryFree>
contemperatio: <entryFree id="n10745" type="main" key="contempe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contempĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contempero</etym>, <sense id="n10745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable mixture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 2:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 2, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contempero: <entryFree id="n10746" type="main" key="contempe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to moderate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">temper by mixing</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): cantharum mulso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 6, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplabilis: <entryFree id="n10747" type="main" key="contempla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemplor</etym>, <sense id="n10747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aiming, taking aim</hi> (only in Amm.): <cit><quote lang="la">dextera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplābĭlĭter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferire aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>taking aim</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 7, 9</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>
contemplabundus: <entryFree id="n10748" type="hapax" key="contempla_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemplor</etym>, <sense id="n10748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">considering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contemplating attentively</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplatio: <entryFree id="n10749" type="main" key="contempla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attentive considering, a viewing, surveying, contemplation</hi> (in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10749.1" n="I" level="1"> Physical. </sense><sense id="n10749.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injecit contemplationem super umeros,</quote> <trans><tr>cast a look over</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 12, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10749.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">an aiming with a weapon, a taking aim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittis praecipuā contemplatione utantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 194</bibl></cit>; cf. contemplabilis.—</sense><sense id="n10749.4" n="II" level="1"> Mental. </sense><sense id="n10749.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a contemplation, survey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est animorum ingeniorumque naturale quoddam quasi pabulum consideratio contemplatioque naturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 41, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 86</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recti pravique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, scripti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicae felicitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa vis infinitatis et magnā ac diligenti contemplatione dignissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10749.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a consideration, regard</hi> (mostly late Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in the jurists): liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:5" default="NO">3, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:58" default="NO">18, 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr.
