Orell.</author> 3161</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplatione mortis donatio facta, = mortis causā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplativus: <entryFree id="n10750" type="main" key="contempla_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemplative, speculative</hi>: philosophia (opp. activa), <hi rend="ital">theoretical</hi> (formed after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qewrhtiko/s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae pars, Aug. Civ. Dei, 8, 4: vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplator: <entryFree id="n10751" type="main" key="contempla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n10751.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An observer, surveyor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peritissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>a marksman</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10751.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A contemplator, an observer</hi> (very rare): caeli ac deorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4</bibl></cit>, n. 18, p. 361, 4.</sense></entryFree>
contemplatorius: <entryFree id="n10752" type="gloss" key="contempla_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātōrĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">stoxastiko/s</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</entryFree>
contemplatrix: <entryFree id="n10753" type="main" key="contempla_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contemplator</etym>, <sense id="n10753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who observes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contemplates</hi> (very rare): medicina, Cels. praef. 1, prooem. § 91; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 16, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplatus: <entryFree id="n10754" type="main" key="contempla_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from contemplor and contemplo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10755" type="main" key="contempla_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contemplor</etym>. <sense id="n10755.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A consideration, contemplation, observance</hi> (very rare, and only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 66</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10755.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Regard, respect</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplo: <entryFree id="n10756" type="main" key="contemplo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (anteand post-class.; collat. form of contemplor), <sense id="n10756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to survey, behold, observe, consider, contemplate</hi>, etc.; freq. in <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adspecta et contempla, Epidice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: contempla et templum Cereris ad laevam aspice, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 470, 5</bibl>; Att. and <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> ib. p. 469, 31</bibl>, and 470, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 38 al.</bibl>: contemplo placide formam et faciem virginis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 469, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 285</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 21 al.</bibl>— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Fragm. de Aucup. 3, p. 49</bibl> Stern.—</sense><sense id="n10756.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contemplātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ab contemplato situ Carthaginis rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 36, 6</bibl></cit> dub.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">scripta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 15, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemplor: <entryFree id="n10757" type="main" key="contemplor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-templor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (arch. <sense id="n10757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> contemplarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 10</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>templum, I. A.</etym> (orig. pertaining to the lang. of augury; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 9</bibl> Müll.), <hi rend="ital">to look at, view attentively, to survey, behold, gaze upon, give attention to, observe, consider, contemplate</hi>, = considero (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10757.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically. </sense><sense id="n10757.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: sed Is hac abiit; <cit><quote lang="la">contemplabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis ut contemplata modo sis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplator, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:189" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10757.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum intueor et contemplor unumquemque vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemplari unum quidque otiose et considerare coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum caelum suspeximus caelestiaque contemplati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis pulchritudlnem rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci naturam ab omni parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: vultum, Ter. <pb n="446" /> <cb n="CONT" /> Phorm. 1, 4, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">lituras codicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos in arcā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">udum Tibur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10757.4" n="II" level="1"> Mentally (several times in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">propone tibi duos reges, et id animo contemplare, quod oculis non potes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid secum considerare et contemplari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut totam causam acerrime contemplemini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemporalis: <entryFree id="n10758" type="main" key="contempo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n10758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., contemporary; subst., a contemporary</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 6 sq.</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
contemporaneus: <entryFree id="n10759" type="main" key="contempo^ra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempŏrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempus</etym>, <sense id="n10759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemporary; subst., a contemporary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Varro et Nigidius Caesari et Ciceroni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14</bibl></cit> inscr.</sense></entryFree>
contemporo: <entryFree id="n10760" type="main" key="contempo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tempŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be at the same time, to be contemporary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contempte: <entryFree id="n10761" type="main" key="contempte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temtē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contemno, <sense id="n10761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptibilis: <entryFree id="n10762" type="main" key="contempti^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptĭbĭlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contemno</etym>, <sense id="n10762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemptible</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:37" default="NO">21, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 155</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptibilitas: <entryFree id="n10763" type="main" key="contempti^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptĭbĭlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contemptibilis</etym>, <sense id="n10763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemptibleness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:158" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptim: <entryFree id="n10764" type="main" key="contemptim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contemno</etym>, <sense id="n10764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemptuously, with contempt, scornfully</hi> (a favorite word of Livy; elsewhere rare): superbiter contemptim conterit legiones, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 516, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">imitated: ne nos tam contemptim conteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice de se ac contemptim de Romanis loquentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbe quaedam et contemptim in se contionantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 35, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte consulis succedentes ad castra Romana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38, 8</bibl> Drak.: a Dioxippo contemptim militarem eludente ferociam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 58</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagabantur barbari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 47</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n10764.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. of an inanimate subject: e summo, quasi fulmen, deicit ictos Invidia contemptim in Tartara, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptio: <entryFree id="n10765" type="main" key="contempti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising; disregard, contempt, scorn, disdain</hi> (in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum humanarum contemptio ac despicientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo est dolorum laborumque contemptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>; id. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 30</bibl>; Hortens. Fragm. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 202, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis perpetua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:8:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:4:1:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum inmortalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam non solum hostibus in contemptionem Sabinus veniret, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>was despised by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(adversarii) in contemptionem adducentur, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptor: <entryFree id="n10766" type="main" key="contemptor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who puts small value upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">makes light of a thing, a contemner, despiser</hi> (freq. after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Hor.): divum Mezentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 648</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">superūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni Olympi cum dis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:761" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 761</bibl></cit>: religionum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiae, divitiarum (Cato),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 40, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae infamiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sui (opp. prodigus alieni),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amulius aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri, nullo forabilis ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 170</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnerum leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 240</bibl>: (Cicero) minime sui contemptor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl> (cf. contemno, II.).—</sense><sense id="n10766.1" n="II" level="1"> Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 205</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitionis animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:9" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 9</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> as <pos>adj.</pos>: cui inerat contemptor animus et superbia, <hi rend="ital">a proud, disdainful spirit</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptrix: <entryFree id="n10767" type="main" key="contemptrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptrix</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contemptor</etym>, <sense id="n10767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who puts small value upon a thing, a despiser, contemner</hi> (rare; not in Cic.): mea, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 2</bibl>: superūm propago, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10767.1" n="II" level="1"> Of inanimate and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptrix frigorum eruca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:59" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 4, 15, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudo contemptrix timendorum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:411" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 411</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contemptus: <entryFree id="n10768" type="main" key="contemptus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. and P. a.</hi>, from contemno. <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10769" type="main" key="contemptus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contemptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-temt-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contemno</etym>, <sense id="n10769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising, contemning; contempt, scorn</hi> (first freq. since the Aug. per., but esp. so in Quint.; perh. never in Cic., for in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11, 4</bibl>, prob. the thought only is Ciceronian). </sense><sense id="n10769.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., a despising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(naribus labrisque) derisus, contemptus, fastidium significari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis et hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ambitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 38</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis infamiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui alienique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc superbum apparatum ... sequebantur contemptus omnium hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10769.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., a being despised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis enim ferme contemptus et acris egestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ego contemptūs essem patientior hujus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:859" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptu inter socios nomen Romanum laborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contemptum ex humilitate tulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 14, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:527 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 527 al.</bibl>— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 831</bibl> and 1277.—</sense><sense id="n10769.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an object of contempt</hi>, in phrase contemptui esse or habere, <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque hominibus Gallis prae magnitudine corporum suorum brevitas nostra contemptui est,</quote> <trans><tr>is despised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eviluit, ut contemptui esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteras (caerimonias) contemptui habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 93 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
contendo: <entryFree id="n10770" type="main" key="contendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tendo</orth>, <itype>di, tum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch, stretch out vigorously, to draw tight, strain</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10770.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 815</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 286</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 435</bibl>: tormenta, Sisen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl>: muscipula, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 181, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenacia vincla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 285</bibl></cit>: pontem in alto, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 21</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 358 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oculi contendunt se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 810</bibl></cit>.— Of stringed instruments, <hi rend="ital">to tune by stretching the strings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in fidibus pluribus, si nulla earum ita contenta nervis sit, ut concentum servare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <itype>infra</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>—</sense><sense id="n10770.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10770.3" n="1" level="3"> (Causa pro effectu.) Of weapons, <hi rend="ital">to shoot, hurl, dart, throw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infensam hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 815</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas nervo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:323" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum aërias in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 520</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10770.4" n="2" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">neutr., to stretch, reach, extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec patulum vallis contendit in orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:30" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadocum gens usque ad Cyrresticam ejus regionem parte suā, quae vocatur Cataonia, contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 8, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq. in prose and poetry); <hi rend="ital">act., to strain eagerly, to stretch, exert, to direct one's mental powers to something, to pursue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strive for earnestly;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">neutr., to exert one's self, to strive zealously for something</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10770.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10770.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum fortasse onus, verum tamen dignum, in quo omnis nervos aetatis industriaeque meae contenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contendit omnis nervos Chrysippus, ut persuadeat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:10:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summas vires de palmā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:990" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 990</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum in curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo se dira libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1043" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1043</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen id sibi contendendum aut aliter non transducendum exercitum existimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id contendere et laborare, ne ea, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21, § 52</bibl>: et petere imperium populi et contendere honores, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf., to exert one's self vigorously to do something, to apply one's self with zeal to, to go to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc locum duabus ex partibus oppugnare contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā vi transcendere in hostium naves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugā salutem petere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego nunc hoc contendo ... mutare animum, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum coniti animo potes, quantum labore contendere ... tantum fac ut efficias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quántum potero voce contendam, ut populus hoc Romanus exaudiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">remis, ut eam partem insulae caperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contende quaeso atque elabora, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:14:section=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 14, § 42</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vociferarer et, quantum maxime possem, contenderem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 16, 38 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possis oculo quantum contendere Lynceus (= collineare),</quote> <trans><tr>to aim at</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic., </sense><sense id="n10770.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To direct</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bend one's course eagerly somewhere;</hi> <cb n="CONT" /> or, <hi rend="ital">neutr., to strive to get to a place, to seek to arrive at, to go, march</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">journey hastily to</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10770.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rectā plateā cursum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte unā tantum itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">Bibracte ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ire cum his legionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Britanniam proficisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in provinciam reverti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dyrrhachium petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima litora petere cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 158</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">iter a Vibone Brundisium terrā petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl></cit> Wund.—</sense><sense id="n10770.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiam magnis itineribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc magnis itineribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc magno cursu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde in Italiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fines Sigambrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo loco ad flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Rhenum finesque Germanorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad oppidum Noviodunum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 3, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hostes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Amanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: Tarentum ad Heraclidem Ponticum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 260, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ultimum animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna spectare atque ad ea rectis studiis contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam laudem gloriamque maximis laboribus et periculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10770.17" n="2" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">try one's strength with</hi>, with weapons, by words, in action, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to strive, dispute, fight, contend against, vie with;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo, contra</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adversus aliquem</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">dat., inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.18" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque post id tempus umquam summis nobiscum copiis hostes contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sequanis bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 67</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnis legionibus parvā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum barbaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum victore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum ingenio et arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 24, 23 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum eo de principatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ages. 1, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiis et sumptibus, non probitate neque industriā cum majoribus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilitas cum dignitate et amplitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>.—So with <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamenne vereris, ut possis haec contra Hortensium contendere?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.19" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Contra aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra populum Romanum armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri pro vitulis contra leones summā vi impetuque contendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra vim gravitatemque morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil contra naturam universam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 101</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10770.20" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adversus aliquem</hi>: non contendam ego adversus te, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A, 2.—</sense><sense id="n10770.21" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hirundo cycnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:7" default="NO">1, 14, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindaricis plectris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:101" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 101</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi cum tantopere de potentatu inter se multos annos contenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:784" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 784</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interim proelio equestri inter duas acies contendebatur,</quote> <trans><tr>the contest was carried on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 50</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 28 al.: magis virtute quam dolo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatio non habet quaestionem, de quā contendit orator, sed propter quam contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:3 al" default="NO">7, 9, 3 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo jure contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de his lite contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de personis judicatur, sed de rebus contenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10770.22" n="b" level="4"> In auctions, <hi rend="ital">to vie with in bidding, to bid against</hi>: is liceri non destitit; <cit><quote lang="la">illi quoad videbatur ferri aliquo modo posse, contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:42:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 42, § 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.23" n="3" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To place together in comparison, to compare, contrast;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum, ad</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <case>acc.</case> only. </sense><sense id="n10770.24" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: tuam iram contra cum ira Liberi, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. p. 259:1" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. p. 259, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id cum defensione nostrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem meam cum tuā ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 32 al.</bibl>: suam vitam mecum, Licinius, Macer. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10770.25" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: ut vim contendas tuam ad majestatem viri, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 259, 5</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 648 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n10770.26" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: Thestiadas Ledae, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera potantia Aquinatem fucum Sidonio ostro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10770.27" n="(d)" level="5"> With <pb n="447" /> <cb n="CONT" /> <case>acc.</case> only: anulum, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 258, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsas causas, quae inter se confligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quaeque nobilitatem, formam, opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetera et praesentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.28" n="4" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To demand, ask, solicit, entreat, beg earnestly, to seek to gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a me peteret et summe contenderet, ut suum propinquum defenderem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verecundius a te, si quae magna res mihi petenda esset, contenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 7, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a magistris de proferendo die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 30, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:5:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 5, § 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid contra aequitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni opere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno opere, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pertinaciter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.29" n="5" level="3"> (<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>) <hi rend="ital">To assert, affirm earnestly, to maintain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contend energetically.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10770.30" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ego hoc contendo, me tibi ipsi adversario cujuscumque tribus rationem poposceris redditurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:50:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 50, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud eos contendit falsa esse delata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud pro me majoribusque meis contendere ausim, nihil nos ... scientes fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; Quint. prooem. § 11; 1, 2, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1343</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:855" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 855</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 37 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10770.31" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si manantia corpuscula iter claudunt, ut Asclepiades contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § 28.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10770.32" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">stretched, strained, tense, tight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jam contento, jam laxo fune laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 325</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentis oculis prosequi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentis corporibus facilius feruntur onera (opp. remissa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:23:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 23, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentā cervice trahunt plaustra (boves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Placideiani contento poplite miror Proelia,</quote> <trans><tr>with the knee stiffly bent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10770.33" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">eager, intent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contenta mens fuit in eā ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:965" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 965</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 515</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et contentā voce atrociter dicere et summissā leniter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:17:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tribunatum contento studio cursuque veniamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentissimā voce clamitans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tentē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">earnestly, with great exertion, vehemently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se dicere ... mittere contentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acriter atque contente pro suis decretis propugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentissime clamitare, App. Flor. n. 8: contentius ambulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamentis iisdem uti fere licebit, alias contentius, alias summissius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid curiose atque contente lectitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contenebrasco: <entryFree id="n10771" type="hapax" key="conte^ne_^brasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕnē^brasco</orth>, <itype>brāvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [tenebrae; cf. vesperasco], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow very dark</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contenebresco: <entryFree id="n10772" type="main" key="conte^ne_^bresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕnē^bresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [tenebrae], <hi rend="ital">to grow dark</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 13, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contenebro: <entryFree id="n10773" type="main" key="conte^ne_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕnē^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make very dark, to darken</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jejun. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contente: <entryFree id="n10774" type="main" key="contente_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contendo, <sense id="n10774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10775" type="main" key="contente_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contineo, <sense id="n10775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
contentio: <entryFree id="n10776" type="main" key="contenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contendo</etym> (acc. to contendo, II.), <sense id="n10776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an eager stretching, a straining, exertion</hi> of the powers of body or mind, <hi rend="ital">tension, effort, a vigorous struggling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">striving for something, a struggle after</hi> (very freq. and in good prose). </sense><sense id="n10776.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10776.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentio et summissio vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:24:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis aut lateris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:137 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 85, § 137 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitatis et ponderum,</quote> <trans><tr>of gravitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi (opp. relaxatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the object: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum (with ambitio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">palmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatis dignitatisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 11 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10776.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10776.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Labored, formal speech</hi> (opp. talk, conversation): quoniam magna vis orationis est, eaque duplex, altera contentionis, altera sermonis; <cit><quote lang="la">contentio disceptationibus tribuatur judiciorum ... sermo in circulis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 48</bibl> Heine ad loc.; cf.: sermo est oratio remissa et finitima cottidianae<cb n="CONT" />  locutioni; <cit><quote lang="la">contentio est oratio acris, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 13, 23</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10776.5" n="2" level="3"> Gregum = admissura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10776.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10776.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to contendo, II. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">A contest, contention, strife</hi> (with weapons or words), <hi rend="ital">a fight, dispute, controversy</hi> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones proeliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:27:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentiones, quae cum inimicissimis fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:11:25 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 11, 25 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:132" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:12 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus procuratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter aliquos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter aliquos de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">contentionis cupidiores quam veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10776.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to contendo, II. B. 3.) <hi rend="ital">A comparison, contrast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contentio quaedam et comparatio fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 43, 152</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:12:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 12, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam hominum ipsorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:39:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 39, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10776.9" n="2" level="3"> T. t. </sense><sense id="n10776.10" n="a" level="4"> In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">a contrasting of one thought with another, antithesis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 15, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:2" default="NO">9, 2, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10776.11" n="b" level="4"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">comparison</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 75</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
contentiose: <entryFree id="n10777" type="main" key="contenti^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contentiosus <sense id="n10777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contentiosus: <entryFree id="n10778" type="main" key="contenti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contentio</etym>, <sense id="n10778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to contention, contentious, disputatious, headstrong, obstinate, pertinacious</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">contentiosa et pugnax oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid contentiosius, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 174" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicies,</quote> <trans><tr>obstinate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 202, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tentĭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pertinaciously, obstinately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Jovin. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 1.</sense></entryFree>
contentus: <entryFree id="n10779" type="main" key="contentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stretched, strained, exerted;</hi> v. <itype>contendo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10780" type="main" key="contentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contented, content;</hi> v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></sense></entryFree>
conterebro: <entryFree id="n10781" type="main" key="conte^re_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕrē^bro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to pierce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bore through</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conterebromius: <entryFree id="n10782" type="main" key="Conte^re^bro^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Contĕrĕbrŏmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>conteroBromius</etym>, a humorously-coined epithet for <sense id="n10782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Libya, which Bacchus traversed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">where much wine is pressed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contermino: <entryFree id="n10783" type="main" key="contermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>conterminus</etym>: alicui, <sense id="n10783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a borderer, to border upon;</hi> perh. only <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 6, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conterminum: <entryFree id="n10784" type="main" key="contermi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. conterminus.</entryFree>
conterminus: <entryFree id="n10785" type="main" key="contermi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-termĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., bordering upon, neighboring, having a common border</hi> (not ante-Aug.; perh. first used by Ovid). </sense><sense id="n10785.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10785.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10785.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morus fonti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 774</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 315</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:553" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus tiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:621" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 621</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aethiopia Aegypto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 14, 28, § 90</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10785.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locos jugi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 178, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 180, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">aesculus aedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:510" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum lacu aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10785.6" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10785.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighboring region, a confine, border</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contermino Arabiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longinqua et contermina Scythiae fugam maturavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contermĭ-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10785.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:702" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 702</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conternans: <entryFree id="n10786" type="main" key="conternans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conternans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. conterno <sense id="n10786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conternatio: <entryFree id="n10787" type="main" key="conterna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conternātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conterno</etym>, <sense id="n10787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a placing of three things together</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Lim. p. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Lim. p. 191</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
conterno: <entryFree id="n10788" type="main" key="conterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-terno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>terni</etym>, <sense id="n10788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put three things together, to make threefold</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Lim. p. 191" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Lim. p. 191</bibl> Goes.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">conternans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">three years old</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitula conternans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contero: <entryFree id="n10789" type="main" key="conte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi</itype> (rarely conterui, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 212, 12</bibl>; Ven. Fort. C. 6, 4, 33), trītum, 3, <sense id="n10789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to grind, bruise, pound, to crumble, separate into small pieces</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10789.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (so freq. in medic. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">medium scillae cum aquā ad mellis crassitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua cervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendis infamia pabula sucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem aridam in pulverem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 70, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fracta, contrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 697</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class. in prose and poetry, </sense><sense id="n10789.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish by <cb n="CONT" /> rubbing, to waste, destroy</hi> (cf.: conficio, consumo, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to rub off, wear out</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10789.3" n="A" level="2"> Of material objects: <cit><quote lang="la">latera tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves et vires agricolarum (followed by conficere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1161</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conteritur ferrum, silices tenuantur ab usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 91</bibl></cit>: superbiter contemptim conterit legiones, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 516, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">humorously imitated: ne nos tam contemptim conteras,</quote> <trans><tr>treat contemptuously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">conteris Tu tuā me oratione, mulier,</quote> <trans><tr>you wear me out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 65</bibl></cit> (cf. B. 1. b. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ipsa ac manus silvis ac paludibus emuniendis inter verbera ac contumelias conterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heri in tergo meo Tris facile corios contrivisti bubulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Viam Sacram,</quote> <trans><tr>to tread upon frequently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 23, 15: <foreign lang="greek">*paidei/an *ku/rou</foreign> legendo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wear out with reading</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellectilem pluribus et diversis officiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to wear out by use</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquas indigno quaestu, i. e. prostituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tero.—Prov.: is vel Herculi conterere quaestum possiet,</quote> <trans><tr>squander the greatest possible fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 68</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n10789.4" n="B" level="2"> Of immaterial objects. </sense><sense id="n10789.5" n="1" level="3"> Most freq. (like the simple verb) of time, <hi rend="ital">to waste, consume, spend, pass, employ</hi>, in a good and bad sense (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl> Kritz); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case> or the <case>abl.</case> only, with <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10789.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem in pistrino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam atque aetatem meam in quaerendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem in litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne otiosum tempus in studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem in eā arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:46" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum hunc diem cursando atque ambulando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majorem aevi partem somno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1047" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1047</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora spectaculis, etc.,</quote> <bibl
