n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei brevitatem conviviis, longitudinem noctis stupris et flagitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum otium socordiā atque desidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10789.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrivi diem, Dum asto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.9" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">se, ut Plato, in musicis, geometriā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in medial form: cum in causis et in negotiis et in foro conteramur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 249</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.11" n="2" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">operam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">operam frustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sunt horum temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10789.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus omnis gravissimas injurias quasi voluntariā oblivione,</quote> <trans><tr>to obliterate from the memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: quam (dignitatem virtutis) reliquā ex collatione, facile est conterere atque contemnere, <hi rend="ital">to tread under foot by comparison</hi> (opp. in caelum efferre), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:30:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 30, 85</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., worn out, trite, common</hi> (mostly in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">proverbium vetustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta (connected with communia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contritum et contemptum praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 40, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conterraneus: <entryFree id="n10790" type="hapax" key="conterra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-terrānĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>terra</etym>, <sense id="n10790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-countryman</hi> (castrense verbum), Plin. praef. § 1 (Codd. Barb. concerraneum = congerronem, which is perh. better; cf. Sillig ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
conterreo: <entryFree id="n10791" type="main" key="conterre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n10791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to terrify greatly, to frighten</hi> (not freq. before the Aug. per.; esp. freq. in Livy); constr. with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10791.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: pectora vulgi metu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 623</bibl>: loquacitatem nostram vultu ipso aspectuque, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervum subito vocibus venantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrox ingenium eo facto (opp. accendere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animos eā re (opp. irritare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos seditioso clamore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 39, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrocitate poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10791.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui praeter Nioben unam conterruit omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insolitos ejus tumultus equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">major solito apparatus praecipue conterruit Campanos, ne ab obsidione Capuae bellum ejus anni Romani inciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">49 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
conterrito: <entryFree id="n10792" type="main" key="conterri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conterrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>conterreo</etym>, <sense id="n10792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten much</hi> or <hi rend="ital">greatly</hi>, Coripp. 2, Joann. 54; 88.</sense></entryFree>
conterritus: <entryFree id="n10793" type="main" key="conterri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conterrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of conterreo.</entryFree>
contesseratio: <entryFree id="n10794" type="hapax" key="contesse^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contessĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contessero</etym>, <sense id="n10794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the contracting of friendship</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haeret. 20</bibl>. <pb n="448" /> <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>
contessero: <entryFree id="n10795" type="main" key="contesse^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tessĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>tessera</etym>, <sense id="n10795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to contract friendsnip by means of the</hi> tesserae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haeret. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contestatio: <entryFree id="n10796" type="main" key="contesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contestor</etym>. <sense id="n10796.0" n="I" level="1"> A jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an attesting, proving by witness, testimony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suprema testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:20:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 20, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum (testamentum) compositum a mentis contestatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:12:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: litis, <hi rend="ital">a formal entering of a suit in law, by calling witnesses</hi>, Gai inst. 3, 180 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:40:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 40, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22:section=5" default="NO">24, 3, 22, § 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 9</bibl>: de litis contestatione.—</sense><sense id="n10796.1" n="B" level="2"> Out of the circle of judicial proceedings, <hi rend="ital">attestation, conclusive proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam miserā atque maestā publicae injuriae contestatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10796.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An earnest entreaty</hi>: petivit tamen a me pater maximā contestatione, ut, etc., * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Corn. 1</bibl> Fragm. 5 B. and K.</sense></entryFree>
contestatiuncula: <entryFree id="n10797" type="hapax" key="contesta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contestatio</etym>, <sense id="n10797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short speech</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contestatus: <entryFree id="n10798" type="main" key="contesta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. contestor.</entryFree>
contestificans: <entryFree id="n10799" type="hapax" key="contesti^fi^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-testĭfĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [testificor], <sense id="n10799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">attesting at the same time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Testim. Anim. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contestor: <entryFree id="n10800" type="main" key="contestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-testor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to take</hi> or <hi rend="ital">call to witness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10800.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10800.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos hominesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:29:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 29, § 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum noctemque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 40, 102</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10800.3" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: contestari, <hi rend="ital">to be called to witness</hi>, P. Aufidius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n10800.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <trans><tr>to introduce a lawsuit by calling witnesses, to bring an action, to set on foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 9 al.</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57, 18</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n10800.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: lis contestatur, Lex Gall. Cisalp. 1, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:4:26:section=5 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 4, 26, § 5 al.</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lite contestata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lis contestata cum Flavio damni injuriā esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 22</bibl> et saep.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n10800.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contestātō</orth>, <itype>adverbially</itype>, <hi rend="ital">by aid of witnesses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:1 al" default="NO">25, 3, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10800.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: contestatus, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">proved by witness, tried</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hac perenni contestataque virtute majorum,</quote> <trans><tr>proved</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contexo: <entryFree id="n10801" type="main" key="contexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-texo</orth>, <itype>xŭi, xtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n10801.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to weave, entwine, braid, join together; to interweave, unite, connect</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10801.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10801.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut earum (ovium) villis confectis atque contextis homines vestiantur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alba lilia amarantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: haec directā materiā injecta contexebantur, <hi rend="ital">these</hi> (<hi rend="ital">beams</hi>) <hi rend="ital">were held together by timbers laid in a straight direction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23, 4</bibl> (cf. Jahn, Neue Jahrb. 1855, p. 516 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">fossam loricamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tam contextae cum sint (animae cum corporibus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 695</bibl></cit>.—With <case>dat.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">optime epilogum defensioni contexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7</bibl></cit> (3), 20, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleribus scelera contexens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est aetas hominis, nisi memoria rerum veterum cum superiorum aetate contexitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuncte nostra cum reliquis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema cum primis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his et plasticen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. 7; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 1, 6: in verbis singulis et contextis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:23 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 23 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius hoc carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>to weave on, continue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 8, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">interrupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris nostri commentarios rerum gestarum Galliae, Auct. B. G. 8, prooem.: quae statim referri non poterant, contexuntur postero die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to join together, to compose, make, construct, form, put together</hi> (cf.: compono, conecto, consero, etc.). </sense><sense id="n10801.5" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum trabibus acernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes tenui cannā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccum tenui vimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>to devise, contrive, invent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10801.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: contexere de aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to treat of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 18, § 36</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">contextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., cohering, connected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contexta condensaque corpora (opp. diffusa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio alia vincta atque contexta, soluta alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: tropos ille (corresp. with continua <foreign lang="greek">metafora/</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 46</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contex-tē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">connected together, in close connection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia necesse est colligatione naturali conserte contexteque fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 14, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contextim: <entryFree id="n10802" type="main" key="contextim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contexo</etym>, <sense id="n10802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a connected<cb n="CONT" />  manner, connectedly</hi> (very rare): luto nidificantes paene contextim, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 147</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 112:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 112, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contextio: <entryFree id="n10803" type="main" key="contexti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contexo</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n10803.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A joining, putting together</hi> (opp. resolutio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10803.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preparing, composing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis, Aus. prooem. Per. lliad: libri, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 2: narrationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contextor: <entryFree id="n10804" type="hapax" key="contextor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who puts a writing together, a composer, author</hi>: codicis, Cod. Th. 1, 1, 6, § 2.</sense></entryFree>
contextus: <entryFree id="n10805" type="main" key="contextus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from contexo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10806" type="main" key="contextus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contextus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contexo</etym>, <sense id="n10806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">putting together, a connection</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. signif., and in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10806.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: corporum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 243</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the building of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Odyss. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10806.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">connection, coherence</hi> (very freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">mirabilis est apud illos (sc. Stoicos) contextus rerum: respondent extrema primis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in toto quasi contextu orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 23, 82</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum ac verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:24" default="NO">11, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per partes dissolvitur, quod contextu nocet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:55" default="NO">9, 4, 55</bibl>. historia non tam finitos numeros quam orbem quendam contextumque desiderat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 129</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ernest. Lex. Techn. p. 90: litterarum,</quote> <trans><tr>the succession of the letters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:24 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 24 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in contextu operis,</quote> <trans><tr>in the course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contheroleta: <entryFree id="n10807" type="hapax" key="conthe_ro^le^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-thērŏlĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hybr., <foreign lang="greek">qhrole/ths</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n10807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-destroyer of wild beasts</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conticeo: <entryFree id="n10808" type="main" key="conti^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>a strengthened form for taceo</etym>, <sense id="n10808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be silent, be still</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:98" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 64</bibl>; cf.: conticeo, <foreign lang="greek">siwpw=</foreign>, Gloss. Lab.; v. also conticesco.</sense></entryFree>
conticesco: <entryFree id="n10809" type="main" key="conti^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcesco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcisco</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>), tĭcŭi, 3, <sense id="n10809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch., to become still, to cease speaking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sounding</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10809.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed conticiscam: nam audio aperiri foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quod ille quidem conticescit, sed sermonem suscipit Polus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hos casus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in such cases</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiā convictus repente conticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: consedit ille; <cit><quote lang="la">conticui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conticuere omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 293</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 430</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10809.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To keep silence, not to speak</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">paulisper alter, alterius conspectu, conticuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum nefas conticuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:302" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 302</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10809.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam de vobis (hominum) gratissimus sermo conticescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla umquam aetas de tuis laudibus conticescet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: conticuit lyra, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:80" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conticuere undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 574</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10809.4" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become still</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quiet, come to rest, cease, decline, stop, abate</hi> (syn. obmutesco): <cit><quote lang="la">cum obmutuisset senatus, judicia conticuissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tum conticisceret illa lamentatio et gemitus urbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Red. Sen. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:94:324" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 94, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae forenses et senatoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones tribuniciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 55, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 55, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 29, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conticinium: <entryFree id="n10810" type="main" key="conti^ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>conticesco, the time when all becomes still; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 7</bibl>, and 7, § 79 Müll.; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcĭum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 3, 12</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n10810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the first part of the night, the evening</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 95</bibl> (quoted in Varr. l. l.); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 268</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conticisco: <entryFree id="n10811" type="main" key="conti^cisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. conticesco.</entryFree>
contifices: <entryFree id="n10812" type="gloss" key="conti^fi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭfĭces</orth>, <sense id="n10812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spearmen</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">para/boloi</foreign>, Gloss. Vet. [contus-facio].</sense></entryFree>
contiger: <entryFree id="n10813" type="hapax" key="conti^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contus-gero</etym>, <sense id="n10813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spear-bearer, a lancer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
contignatio: <entryFree id="n10814" type="main" key="contigna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contigno, a joining together of beams; hence, concrete</etym>, <sense id="n10814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a floor composed of joists and boards; a story, floor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
contigno: <entryFree id="n10815" type="main" key="contigno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tigno</orth>, no <sense id="n10815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tignum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to join together with beams, to furnish with beams, joists</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rafters</hi> (rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 3, 2, § 7</bibl>. <cb n="CONT" /></sense></entryFree>
contignum: <entryFree id="n10816" type="gloss" key="contignum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contignum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contigno</etym>, <sense id="n10816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a structure of beams;</hi> meton., <hi rend="ital">a piece of flesh with seven ribs</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
contigue: <entryFree id="n10817" type="main" key="conti^gu^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭgŭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. contiguus <sense id="n10817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
contiguus: <entryFree id="n10818" type="main" key="conti^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contingo</etym> (not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n10818.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (lit. touching; hence), <hi rend="ital">bordering upon, neighboring, contiguous, near; absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pyramus et Thisbe) contiguas tenuere domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadoces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna montibus (opp. admota caelo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perit Valens quinquagesimo anno contiguus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 410</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n10818.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., that may be touched, within reach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ubi contiguum missae fore credidit hastae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 457</bibl></cit> (intra jactum teli, Serv.).—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭgŭē</orth> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">closely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>upon his heels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 909</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
continens: <entryFree id="n10819" type="main" key="conti^nens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1.</entryFree>
continenter: <entryFree id="n10820" type="main" key="conti^nenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, 1. <sense id="n10820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
continentia: <entryFree id="n10821" type="main" key="conti^nenti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contineo</etym>. <sense id="n10821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A holding back, repressing</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n10821.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(crepitūs ventris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10821.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to contineo, I. B. 2. b., and continens, B.), <hi rend="ital">a briding, restraining of one's passions and desires, abstemiousness, continence, temperance, moderation</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)gkra/teia</foreign> (the common signif.; most freq. in Cic.; it is diff. from abstinentia, v. in h. v.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. libido): continentia est, per quam cupiditas consilii gubernatione regitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 86</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:121" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferte hujus libidines cum illius continentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pro continentiā et aequitate libido atque superbia invasere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">connected with modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:15 al" default="NO">3, 7, 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10821.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to contineo, I. B. 3., and continens, C.) <hi rend="ital">The contents of a work</hi> (only late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 12, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 5, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23, 11</bibl>; so the title of the work of Fulgentius: De Expositione Vergilianae Continentiae, etc.— * </sense><sense id="n10821.4" n="III" level="1"> (Acc. to contineo, II., and continens, A. 1.) <hi rend="ital">Contiguity, proximity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionum (just before: cohaerentia regionum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10822" type="main" key="conti^nenti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>contineo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
contineo: <entryFree id="n10823" type="main" key="conti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>tĭnŭi, tentum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>teneo</etym>. <sense id="n10823.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep together</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10823.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rare). </sense><sense id="n10823.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">coërceo, conjungo): contine quaeso caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnem continet amplexu terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 319</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus omnia conplexu suo coërcet et continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:22:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem levi nodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni refert primordia saepe cum quibus ... contineantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 818</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:908" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 908</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:761" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 761</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 1008: pars oppidi, mari dijuncta angusto, ponte adjungitur et continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.3" n="b" level="4"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to bound, limit, enclose</hi> (very rare in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum spatium mons continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus ponto qua continet orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:147" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 147</bibl></cit>; but more freq. in <hi rend="ital">pass., to be comprised, enclosed, surrounded, encompassed, environed by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vicus altissimis montibus undique continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">undique loci naturā Helvetii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare montibus angustis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una pars Galliae Garumnā flumine, Oceano, finibus Belgarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes artes quasi cognatione quādam inter se continentur,</quote> <trans><tr>hang together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. in all periods and species of composition., </sense><sense id="n10823.5" n="B" level="2"> With partic. access. ideas. </sense><sense id="n10823.6" n="1" level="3"> With the access. idea of firmness, quiet, permanence, etc., <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep together, to keep, hold fast, preserve, retain</hi> (syn. servo). </sense><sense id="n10823.7" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(alvus) arcet et continet ... quod recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces (opp. partiri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum (opp. dividere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida continent odorem diutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 7, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla res vehementius rem publicam continet quam fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Remos reliquosque Belgas in officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in officio Dumnorigem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in exercitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te in tuis perenuibus studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros in armis (plaga),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus hospitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.9" n="2" level="3"> With the access. idea of hindering, preventing motion, <hi rend="ital">to keep, keep still, detain, restrain, repress, enclose</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10823.10" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: milites <pb n="449" /> <cb n="CONT" /> sub pellibus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudem sub tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:10:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 9, 14 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros in castris (tempestates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 36</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 30</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 1; 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium quam angustissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem limine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora frenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventos carcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:61:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 61, 261</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">se ruri,</quote> <trans><tr>to stay, remain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo se loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido sese,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris se continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se finibus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 58, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum suorum terminis se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese intra silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos intra munitionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 57</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 58: milites intra castrorum vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 24: intra castra militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidibus provinciarum propagavit imperium, ut a peritis et assuetis socii continerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 23</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">an te auspicium commoratum est? an tempestas continet?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.11" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hold back, detain, repress, hold in check, curb, check, stay, stop, tame, subdue</hi>, etc. (syn. cohibeo): <cit><quote lang="la">adpetitiones animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modeste insolentiam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 71</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">formido mortales omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruriam non tam armis quam judiciorum terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 36, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida magis metu quam fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam continet metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solo metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum a consuetā libidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem ab omni lapsu (with cohibere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos a proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum juventus Metu deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:37 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 37 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab adsentiendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 104</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se ab exemplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperans, qui se in aliquā libidine continuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se male continet amens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male me, quin vera faterer, Continui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:729" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo continere quin loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: contineri, quin complectar, non queo,</quote> <trans><tr>restrain myself, refrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 128</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix me contineo, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam nequeo contineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix contineor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vera audivi, taceo et contineo optime,</quote> <trans><tr>keep it to myself, conceal it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae continet, neque adhuc protulit, explicet nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:47:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 47, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 222</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.12" n="3" level="3"> With the access. idea of containing, <hi rend="ital">to comprise, contain, involve, comprehend something in itself</hi> (syn. complector): <cit><quote lang="la">(aqua gelum) quod continet in se, mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:877" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 877</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia, quae aluntur et crescunt, contineant in se vim caloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:2" default="NO">2, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quattuor aeternus genitalia corpora mundus Continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem militarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis innumeras paene continet medicinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(linea) centum continet (pedes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idus Martiae magnum mendum continent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucas species (vox),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales res, quales hic liber continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 43, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationes, quae summam criminis contineant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula stultorum regum et populorum continet aestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liber primus ea continebit, quae, etc., Quint. prooem. § 21: tertia epistula continebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando ipsos loqui deceat, quartus liber continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n10823.13" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: contineri <hi rend="ital">aliquā re, to be contained in something, be composed of, consist of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in, to rest upon, to be supported by</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">terreno corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1085" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1085</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non venis et nervis et ossibus continentur (dii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem negabat esse ullam, nisi quae cognitis penitusque perspectis ... rebus contineretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma honestatis, quae tota quattuor his virtutibus ... continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus paucis (pedibus) continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: quae philosophorum libris continentur, id. prooem. § 11; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 111</bibl> et saep.: artes, quae conjecturā continentur <cb n="CONT" /> et sunt opinabiles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:1" default="NO">12, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:28" default="NO">3, 7, 28</bibl>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum, in quo omnis aequitas continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (legibus) in singulis civitatibus res publica continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to hold together in itself, to hang together</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> very rare; but freq. as <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> cf. also the deriv. continuus): <cit><quote lang="la">per hortum utroque commeatus continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10823.15" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10823.16" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Holding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hanging together</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10823.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bordering upon, neighboring, contiguous, lying near, adjacent</hi> (syn.: junctus, adjunctus, contiguus); constr. with <hi rend="ital">dat., cum</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10823.18" n="a" level="4"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aër mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:45:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 45, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continentia atque adjuncta praedia huic fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mare) dissimile est proximo ei continenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadociae pars ea, quae cum Cilicià continens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Morini) continentes silvas ac paludes habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum locuples continente ripā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pars eorum, qui propiores erant continenti litori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnentĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">adjoining places, the neighborhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cherronesum et continentia usque Atho montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:215 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 215 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <trans><tr>the suburbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:147" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 147</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.19" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in time, <hi rend="ital">following, next</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">continentibus diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of other abstract things: motus sensui junctus et continens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori perpetuo ipsum malum continens fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>followed at its heels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.20" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Holding together, cohering in itself, connected, continuous, uninterrupted</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10823.21" n="a" level="4"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">continens agmen migrantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 50, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; terra, <hi rend="ital">the mainland, continent</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 100</bibl> P.; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 274, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 2</bibl>; and in the same sense far more freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (rarely <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl> Zumpt, dub.; <case>abl.</case> in <hi rend="ital">e</hi> and <hi rend="ital">i</hi> equally used; <cit><quote lang="la">v. the 4th and 5th books of Caes. B. G.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 31</bibl>; 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">bis</hi> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 43, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 34, § 128</bibl>; Suet <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:65" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Tib. 40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 40</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10823.22" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in time, <hi rend="ital">continual, consecutive, uninterrupted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor omnium dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium usque ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber per noctem totam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres sine intermissione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e continenti genere,</quote> <trans><tr>in continuous descent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit> et saep.: ex continenti (sc. tempore), <hi rend="ital">instantly, immediately</hi>, = continuo, statim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in continenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.23" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 2. b.) <hi rend="ital">That restrains his passions, continent, moderate, temperate</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)gkrath/s</foreign> (rare, but in good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">continentior in vitā hominum quam in pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum reges tam sint continentes, multo magis consularis esse oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epaminondas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.24" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) In rhet., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that on which something rests</hi> or <hi rend="ital">depends, the chief point, hinge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:29:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 29, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:25:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 25, 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intuendum videtur, quid sit quaestio, ratio, judicatio, continens, vel ut alii vocant, firmamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 18 sqq.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contĭnen-ter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n10823.25" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to A. 2.) </sense><sense id="n10823.26" n="a" level="4"> In space, <hi rend="ital">in unbroken succession, in a row.</hi> continenter sedetis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 6</bibl>.—More freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n10823.27" n="b" level="4"> In time, <hi rend="ital">continuously, without interruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā nocte ierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam amplius horis sex pugnaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum lapidibus pluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usque ad ipsum negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri imagines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 39, 109</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10823.28" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to B.) <hi rend="ital">Temperately, moderately</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>; in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 199" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Conf. 6, 12</bibl>.—Hence also, </sense><sense id="n10823.29" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">contentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 2. b.); medial., <hi rend="ital">satisfying one's self with, contented, satisfied, content</hi> (freq. in all periods and species of composition); constr. in gen. with the <case>abl.</case>; more rarely <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> after the Aug. per. very freq. with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10823.30" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: his versibus, Lucil. ap. Non. <cb n="CONT" /> p. 264, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">suis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illā (sorte),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viverem uti contentus eo quod mī ipse parasset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 108</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solā Dianā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 582</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.31" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsum audires sine comparatione, non modo contentus esses, sed melius non quaereres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:35:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 35, 134</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10823.32" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">indagare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edidicisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:638" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinere titulum provinciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:49" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sustinuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:128" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id consequi, quod imiteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 2, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">contentē</orth> (ante-and post-class., and rare), <hi rend="ital">in a restrained manner, closely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte contenteque habere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce contenteque vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pan. Theod. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
contingo: <entryFree id="n10824" type="main" key="contingo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tingo</orth>, <itype>tĭgi, tactum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tango</etym>, <sense id="n10824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch on all sides. to touch, take hold of, seize</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n10824.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10824.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">facile cibum terrestrem rostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funem manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 239</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera Cerealia dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:457" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">focos ore tremente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram osculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora nati sacro medicamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:607" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 607</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes suo igni (sol),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 407</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 408</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos sale modico,</quote> <trans><tr>to sprinkle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>: sidera comā (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation for a very great height), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes aërio vertice (Taurus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: summa sidera plantis, <hi rend="ital">to reach the stars</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation of great prosperity), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitem taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:860" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 860</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:423" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 423</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paene terram (luna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras consulum (as a friendly greeting or congratulation),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 9, 6</bibl></cit>;
