so, <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:104:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 104, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107:4" default="NO">2, 107, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.3" n="B" level="2"> With partic. access. ideas. </sense><sense id="n10824.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To eat, partake of, taste</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque illinc Audeat esuriens dominus contingere granum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:409" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 409</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch impurely</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be near, neighboring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">contiguous, to border upon, to reach, extend to;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc., dat.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inter se;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helvi, qui fines Arvernorum contingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turri adactā et contingente vallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in saltu Vescino Falernum contingente agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium coloniarum Illyricum contingentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 25</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut radices montis ex utrāque parte ripae fluminis contingant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (milites) contingant inter se atque omnem munitionem expleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10824.7" n="4" level="3"> With the idea of motion, <hi rend="ital">to reach something by moving, to attain to, reach, come to, arrive at, meet with</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>); with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">optatam metam cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephyren pennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines Illyricos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cadmeïda arcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:217" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidas Phasidos undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras,</quote> <trans><tr>to come into the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:416" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 416</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">avem ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>to hit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 509</bibl></cit>; cf. Ov M. 8, 351: ullum mortalem (vox mea), id. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 578</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">thus aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 211</bibl></cit>; and aures fando, with the <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 497</bibl>: aevi florem, <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reach the flower of age</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 565</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10824.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to touch, to seize upon, affect</hi> (rare). multitudo agrestium, quos in aliquā suā fortunā publica quoque contingebat cura, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contactus nullis ante cupidinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam me manifesta libido contigit!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 484</bibl></cit>: animum curā. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:173" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 173</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (curā), contacti simili sorte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 78</bibl></cit>. —Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10824.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10824.11" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">To touch with pollution, to pollute, stain, defile</hi>, etc.; so generally in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> (as a <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> the kindr. contamino was in use): <cit><quote lang="la">(Gallos) contactos eo scelere velut injectā rabie ad arma ituros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 48, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">contacta civitas rabie duorum juvenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes eā violatione templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 8, 11</bibl></cit> (for which <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 18, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefandà praedā se ipsos ac domos contaminare suas): plebs regiā praedā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 15, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi candidi et nullo mortali opere contacti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 10</bibl></cit>: dies (sc. Alliensis) religione,<pb n="450" /> <cb n="CONT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora vitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>.—Once <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contactus ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 714" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 714</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.12" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 3.) With <hi rend="ital">aliquem aliquā re</hi> or only <hi rend="ital">aliquem, to be connected with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">related to, to concern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque tam foede interemptos aut propinquitate aut amicitiā contingebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sanguine ac genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 22, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem artissimo gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum Caesarum nullo gradu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos (i. e. Maecenatem et Augustum) quoniam propius contingis,</quote> <trans><tr>have more ready access to the great</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinum modico usu,</quote> <trans><tr>to have little intercourse with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis in Italiā contactis gentibus Punici belli societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si crĭmine contingantur,</quote> <trans><tr>have part in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec consultatio Romanos nihil contingit,</quote> <trans><tr>concerns not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 22, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (causa) nihil eo facto contingitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.13" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 4.) <hi rend="ital">To attain to, reach, arrive at something, to come to</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quam regionem cum superavit animus naturamque sui similem contigit et agnovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.14" n="b" level="4"> With and without <case>dat.</case> of person; of occurrences, <hi rend="ital">to happen to one, to befall, fall to one's lot, to succeed in, obtain a thing;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">absol., to happen, fall to, turn out, come to pass</hi> (so most freq. in all perr. and species of composition; in gen., of favorable, but sometimes of indifferent, or even adverse occurrences). </sense><sense id="n10824.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui tam subito tot contigerint commoda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tot propter me gaudia illi contigisse laetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod isti (Crasso) contigit uni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 35, 164</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:153" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:115" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:29" default="NO">12, 11, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3, 10</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 321</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 443</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanto plura bene dicendi exempla supersint quam illis contigerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: quam mihi maxime hic hodie contigerit malum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 268, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (sc. servitus) potentibus populis saepe contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum miseri animi essent, quod plerisque contingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 2 al.</bibl>: quoties ipsi testatori aliquid contingit, <hi rend="ital">a misfortune befalls</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ei humanitus contigerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 4, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (cf. ib. § 2: sive in viā aliquid mihi humanitus acciderit, and v. 2. accido, II. B.).—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cuivis homini contingit adire Corinthum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Romae nutriri atque doceri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi recusare principatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi cognoscere (eos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:11" default="NO">1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:25" default="NO">5, 7, 25</bibl>; 6, 1, 4 al.—And, at the same time, a <case>dat.</case> of the predicate (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quo tempore mihi fratrique meo destinari praetoribus contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximo tibi et civi et duci evadere contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>, ext. 2 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 220</bibl>, the better read. is nepotem); cf. Haase in Reisig. Lect. p. 794 sq.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo hoc oratori contingat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:290" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 84, 290</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:51 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 51 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n10824.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sors Tyrrhenum contigit,</quote> <trans><tr>fell upon Tyrrhenus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam palma frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10824.17" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">hanc mi expetivi, contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis adeo id facilitate quam aliā ullā culpā meā contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si nulla contingit excusatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi quid melius contingit et unctius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 44</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia memoria atque actio naturā non arte contingant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:11 al" default="NO">2, 2, 11 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia, quae continget ex sermone puro atque dilucido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eādem brassicā contingunt aestivi autumnalesque cauliculi,</quote> <trans><tr>arise, spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:138 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 138 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil horum nisi in complexu loquendi serieque contingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere cinctutis non exaudita Cethegis Continget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:25" default="NO">5, 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concitare invidiam, etc.... liberius in peroratione contingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunquam opinatus fui ... id contigit, ut salvi poteremur domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:72" default="NO">9, 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:39" default="NO">11, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10825" type="main" key="contingo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-tingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tinguo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to</hi> <cb n="CONT" /> <hi rend="ital">wet, moisten</hi> (perh. only in Lucr. and Verg.). </sense><sense id="n10825.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oras, pocula circum mellis liquore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:938" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 938</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina rerum colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac parco sale,</quote> <trans><tr>to sprinkle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsum corpus amurcā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 448</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10825.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">musaeo contingens cuncta lepore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 934</bibl></cit> and 947; 4, 9 and 22.</sense></entryFree>
